cons: Breaks with 6 hr shifts were only 10 min. or with 8 hr shifts 30 min. You only get one meal for free while working, no discounts. If you are looking for a slow paced, lenient, sloppy kind of work environment then this job is not for you.

headline: In-N-Out review
pros: Relaxed, friendly atmosphere. Very exciting and always a great time. The people you meet at the restaurant will be friends forever,
cons: Very fast paced. Need to be on your toes at all times. They also sometimes don't do a good job with scheduling.

headline: It's a hard company to work for
pros: great pay and they do work with your schedule well
cons: the customer is always right and going the extra mile can be stressful

headline: Sales Associate
pros: Great company. Benefits. Team atmosphere. Flexible scheduling. lots of earning potential
cons: Intensive labor. Amateur shift managers from the 3rd and 4th sometimes.

headline: Awesome company.
pros: Competitive pay rate and ability to move up while still having flexible schedule.
cons: Be less biased on who to move up based on personal relations outside of work.

headline: Associate
pros: Great job to get you through college.
cons: Constantly on your feet moving around.

headline: Great Experience
pros: it was great company to work for
cons: nothing actually everything was great and amazing but had to move on for my other goals

headline: Good
pros: Had great pay for the work you were doing and benefits were amazing. Great environment, everyone is very positive and supportive of each other.
cons: There were not really any downsides of working here. It is hard work but if your willing to work hard it should not be a problem.

headline: Big company spoils you
pros: Family picnic at Waterworld. Good pay. Paid holidays. Christmas parties and gift s
cons: Lower level management cant handle volume at times. Not many cons!

headline: Decent job
pros:
Free Lunch
Plenty of Hours even for part time associates
cons:
Pay could be better.
Physically demanding job does with not enough rest.

headline: It's a great job for High School students!
pros:
Everyone gets a chance to move up quickly.
It pays well! I started out making $10 an hour, and then two weeks after I started there was a company wide raise of $00.50 and when I left I was making $13.50.
They have great values! They always give Christmas gifts, have company wide sport competitions, and yearly picnics.
cons: Just like every food service place, the customers will sometimes get to you. Sometimes there are associates that are hard to work with, but that's going to happen at every place.

headline: Working conditions
pros: Hard work, but pays well. Introductory pay is $12.50 an hour, and goes up after each "level". Managers make upwards of six figures a year.
cons: Fast paced, and lines are constantly out the door. But that's part of the job. Wouldn't recommend it as a career.

headline: Store Associate at In-N-Out Burger
pros: Excellent team-oriented environment with friendly coworkers
cons: Being scheduled for opening shifts the morning after closing shifts

headline: In-N-Out Associate
pros:
1. Best Customer Service
2. Willing to work with busy schedules
3. Easy to request time off
4. Great teamwork
5. Good bonding activities (soccer, basketball, softball tournaments)
6. They follow all the laws about breaks and minors
cons:
1. They give priority to those who are going to stay there for a while
2. It is hard to get training time to get a raise unless you work 30-35 hours a week
3. Once you turn 18, you will be working till 2 am a lot

headline: Great company
pros:
Work around your schedule 
Friendly managers
Provide training for leveling up
Great Co workers
cons:
Weekends & late nights
Wage caps for every level
Lots of high schoolers

headline: Great
pros: Great pay. Endless adnvancement.
cons: Men have to shave before shift.

headline: Hard Work, Great Pay
pros: The obvious pro to work at In N Out Burger is the pay. $11 an hour is great and if you ask for it, they will give you the hours you need. Everyone that works there is very helpful and really nice about helping you learn the specifics of the job.
cons: It's always busy and the break is only ten minutes long, but those are literally the only bad parts and it's not even that bad. The busyness keeps you preoccupied enough to where you don't look at the clock every five minutes to see how long it is before you can go home.

headline: Amazing Company
pros: Great hours, never boring, opportunities for advancement.
cons: Scheduling, uniforms, breaks, and handheld in the heat.

headline: Shift manager
pros: Great associates, Christmas gifts, summer family company picnic
cons: Little room for creativity, long hours with no set schedule

headline: Cook
pros: You are always encouraged to achieve a higher position in the company.
cons: It isn't for everyone.

headline: Level 7
pros: Company takes care of their employees, great pay, great benefits, paid time off even for part time. A lot of great people and the company provided fun events outside of work.
cons: Some of the people getting promotion are just based on favoritism so you have a lot of manager or upper levels that do not care about quality anymore. They are entitled and it is really hard to deal with someone like that.

headline: Worth the Hardwork
pros: They're good at working around your school or life schedule. They're typically good about scheduling you for the number of hours you ask for. There is also opportunity to move up and receive raises. Many of the managers are very kind and are good at listening to what you have to say.
cons: Hours can be inflexible, they often keep you late, sometimes without asking. Management isn't good about letting people go, so they're often people that really shouldn't be there anymore.

headline: Great Company
pros: Alwaya room for advancement .
cons: Too busy.  Don't always get trained or promoted in the time frame of your plan.

headline: Associate
pros: Good advancement opportunities at local store. Great food!
cons: If you have a good manager, it can be a great job with a great working environment.  When the manager is not good, the morale really drops and people leave, feeling helpless to make any changes or have future advancement opportunities.  They system for moving up needs to be better organized with pre-set timetables for training.

headline: Great first job/career opportunities!
pros: Good starting salary, free food, fast-paced, opportunities to move up quickly, chance to meet great new friends, has a comprehensive training program that makes it easy to learn everything fast.
cons: Requires multi-tasking a lot and can be a bit overwhelming in high-volume times, can be easy to eat here every shift which isn't the healthiest, standing up all day can take a toll

headline: I do most of the cashier jobs and is a fast environment
pros: Work not as a team but a family
cons: Can get stressful especially during the summer

headline: Great Jumping off point
pros:
Company is like a big family, everyone is chill because they are all hired by the same guy in each restaurant so they all fit similar parameters and are good peiple.  
Good pay for the work
Work with you if you need time off
Free burger each shift
You get promoted as fast as you can.  The job is what you make it, if they see you try hard and do well, they will give you more to do.
cons:
Night shifts until 230am.  if you are over 18 then they are mandatory at some point during the week.  
Not exactly a con, but this is the most active job i have ever had.  no standing around and free time while on the clock, you are always doing something.

headline: My time at In-N-Out
pros: The pay and hours are good especially when you're a higher level. You add vacation pay every day you work. You meet lots of different people.
cons: Some of the time you'll get managers that are rude and target certain people. They have favorites and think that if you don't elaborate about your home life you're being rude. Once you give them a two weeks to be nice they no longer care about you and immediately take you off the schedule.

headline: Very good place to work for!
pros: Good management, good training, good pay, room for growth and advancement.
cons: Busy, fast-paced environment. I was fine with the type of environment but for those not willing to work in an extremely populated restaurants, this may not be for you.

headline: Great Company
pros:
Great compensation 
Always room for advancement
cons: You don't always get off when scheduled.

headline: Pretty Good Pay But Expect to Work Hard!
pros: The starting pay is pretty good and with an employer open from 10am-1am or even later there are many different shift available. The wide range of shift helped me with my college school schedule. My managers were pretty good to work with when in came to school. Every few months, if there were no injuries, we would receive safety day gifts in the form on in n out merchandise or gift cards. Also, there are store goals every year and if your store makes the goal, you can earn opportunities to go to places like Disneyland or Knotts for free.
cons: Expect to work weekends and holidays (except for Easter, Thanksgiving and Christmas). Every other holiday is a working holiday and sometimes getting those days off for family vacations or events can sometimes be hard (ex. Labor Day, Memorial Day, MLK Day.. etc). Sometimes if you have closing shift, you will get off anywhere form 2am-2:30am. Also if work is slow, they may ask you to clock out so hours aren't guaranteed. You get paid good but you definitely work hard for your money. Don't expect to be standing around, you have to hustle or you won't do well at this job. Also, if you're a guy, by default you end up doing most of the grunt work. In example, taking out the trash, peeling potatoes and cleaning the grills. Due to this, sometimes it is harder for guys to be promoted to different higher associate levels (more pay) because their opportunities for training on new positions/levels are at times less convenient when they're  needed for those grunt tasks.

headline: Great Company Overall
pros: The company overall is great.  Pay and benefits are above average for fast food industry.  There is plenty of room for advancement.
cons: Opportunities are only part-time but you must be available for any shift at any time which makes working a second job to make ends meet difficult.  Also, the interview process is very challenging.  I had to come for three separate interviews.  I arrived prior to my scheduled appointment time and still waited 40 minutes to over an hour for each interview to begin.  Any company who expects their employees to be punctual to work really needs to practice what they preach.

headline: Work you like dogs, break labor laws all the time, to justify them paying you well.
pros: Good pay, you get a free burger after every shift, some of the coworkers are nice, that's everything that is a pro to working here
cons: Work you like dogs, have been yelled at for wanting to drink water during a rush, have been yelled at for wanting to use the restroom during a rush, these managers want to get there bonuses so bad that they break laws to achieve them, not giving you your break on time for example. The people get way to personal with you. People get more training time based off of personal friendship with manager to get more promotions, if you try and excel and take on new positions they laugh at you for wanting to try and put you down. The environment gets very hostile during rushes, and everyone is so stressed out you can't say a word without getting yelled at by 3 different people at once. Yelling is in n outs favorite thing to do to its employees, I have been told talking wasn't aloud in the work place while working because I'm not getting paid to talk and work I'm getting paid just to work. Just an all around awful experience and you should really consider how hard your working and how poorly management treats its employees before accepting a job here

headline: Best company I've ever had pleasure of working for!
pros: Culture is instilled from ground up. Promotes from within and pace is set by person. Great pay and benefits. Best 16 years of my life!!
cons: My only regret was being stuck at 2nd Man for longer than I expected.  The vision for my future were misaligned and I got impatient.

headline: Great Environment
pros:
free burgers
friendly associates (depending on location)
cons:
rude customers
late hours
tend to get burns

headline: Current
pros: Great environment, always happy, easy to move up, great company that takes care of associates!
cons: Very busy but thats also a good thing!

headline: Level 3 Associate
pros:
Great team oriented crew.
Fast paced work.
Training videos were helpful.
Pay was good.
cons:
Can be stressful.
Shifts can be only 2-3 hours long.
Closing can be a nightmare.

pros:
-free meal
-some of the coworkers are great
cons: Working at in n out had to be the absolute worst summer of my life. The hiring process took well over a month and the job itself was terrible. They constantly schedule too many people to the point where there was nothing for me to do and I just ended up scrubbing dishes and taking trash out, which was not what I was hired to do. I would constantly be sent home an hour or sometimes two hours early just to allow someone else to work. The pay is good but in no way worth it. One shift manger in particular was absolutely awful. He was very unfair and had me do everything. I never heard him treat any of the other associates the way he treated me. I'm going to be quitting very soon and never returning.

headline: In-n-out
pros: Easy job to get no previous experience require. Just be friendly and smile and you should get the job.
cons: My store manager picked favorites. The customer is always right.

headline: Great Company
pros: Great Pay, training can be used in any work setting, not just food industry. Management opportunities are high.
cons: Can be stressful at times. Managers can be either really great or really bad; constantly getting new managers due to either transfers or promotions

headline: Great Place, Fun For Students
pros: With a positive attitude, you will be more than happy here. Great company to work for. They have a  great amount of company culture and it extends from store to store.
cons: Customers could be rude, but that's with any customer service job.

headline: Stress You Can See
pros:
-alright pay
-plenty of hours in the summer 
-free food
-fun picnic, store parties
-freebies like gift cards
-cool co-workers
-gain food industry experience
cons:
-rampant and blatant favoritism, people go up higher levels if they are liked by a manager
-sporadic scheduling- if you take days off, expect to work extra hours for the next few weeks to meet an "average"
-too high expectations, always having to make sacrifices for the sake of the job
-always understaffed, terrible anticipation and planning
-inconsistent quality of managers, always being switched and transferred out

headline: In-N-Out
pros:
Fast paced, welcoming.
Always room for moving up
cons:
Rude customers
Odd/ little hours
Environment is not always positive

headline: Associate
pros: 1 free meal, company picnic, store parties, and company softball games
cons: Pealing potatoes, rude customer (anytime dealing with the public)

headline: INO from Norwalk, CA
pros:
-Free employee meals
-They pay their employees a couple bucks more than minium wage & give them a raise each level they move up
- Will work with the employees schedule
-  They don't question or come after anyone for calling off
- They provide a free festival "SoCal picnic" once a year for employees to attend, it's like a carnival
- Offer dental & eye care insurance for part time workers
- They worry about the safety of their workers and customers
cons:
- Always busy.
- Strict policies.
- A lot of customer complaints.
-Managers can sometimes run the store very poorly and make it a hostile environment to work.
- Too many manager turn overs.
- Upper levels can be unproffesional.
- A lot of unfair favoritism.
- Sloppy training.
- They don't provide the employees enough hours to live off. Sometimes 20 or less a week. 
- Medical insurance is only eligible for those who work 40 hours +more and only managers get those type of hours.
- The kitchen can be too hot to work sometimes and it's not enough space so it'll get packed & be uncomfortable to work.
- The cooks are sometimes not as fast when making the burgers so the line will stall and there'll be a lot of upset customers.

headline: Level 7
pros: Great company who takes care of their associates.  Awesome training and great pay.  Most employees are also great to work with and every one is clean cut
cons: Kind of hard to have a work-life balance. All shifts are different with no consistency.  Not many negatives for this company.

headline: Great for a short term job
pros: Very flexible schedule, lots of opportunity to move up, great first job, great pay.
cons: benefits are only alright, false sense of community, favortism, long hours for little reward, the notion of "the customer is always right, not the employee".

pros: great company cares a lot about its customers and provides excellent training and development
cons: Long hours and unclear off times for managers.  tough on work life balance

headline: In-N-Out
pros: Pay, free food, lots of co workers to meet and cover shifts
cons: Stress, depression, burns and allergies

headline: previous employee
pros: everything was great. The atmosphere was always happy
cons: not enough advancement opportunities for certain workers, based on store management.

headline: Store associate
pros: They definitely have great energy and amazing pay!!! It's so fun to work at in n out.!!!
cons: One thing I really didn't like was the fact that we weren't allowed to wear nail polish and our hair always had to be up.

headline: Very positive atmosphere! Great Values! Great People!
pros: Base Pay is $11.00 Per Hour. Fast paced and Friendly environment. Top quality ingredients and unparalleled service. Free Meal when working shift
cons: High standards of responsibility (taken to the extreme), odd policy of hours (always assume to work a 6hr shift regardless of schedule) no tips and no bonuses

headline: An overrated job
pros:
Terrific people to work with.
Free food! 
Great pay
cons:
Long stupid hours. 
Managers put stupid people in positions of management
Extremely political environment

headline: Great starter job for student or anyone looking for a flexible place and lots of growth opportunities.
pros: Super flexible schedule. You train by levels which means you move up in positions quickly and get raises pretty often. Rotation of job works pretty well so you're not always bored doing the same thing. Lots of awesome gifts for meeting goals and holidays. Also just a really fun, laid back job once you get used to the fast paced environment.
cons: Once you start becoming a higher level (food prep, cooks) it does become very competitive. Food prep seems to only be assigned to certain people, so make sure to speak up if it's not a position you'd like to work every shift. It's very easy to get stuck on produce or cooking because most people don't like it.

headline: Level 4
pros: Great team to work with. Face paced. If you learning and are good at your position you get moved up faster.
cons: White clothes are hard to keep clean, and staying until 2 am or later on the weekends is hard too.

headline: Level 1 Associate
pros: Decent pay for fast food. Clear path for promotion. Free meal everyday. Happy workers who are proud of the company culture.
cons: Smell look food. Cocky employees that forget they're working at a burger joint. Def a summer job for some quick cash vs. long-term in my opinion.

headline: Food Handler
pros: The time goes by extremely fast because it is a fast paced environment. My co-workers were all very fun to work with.
cons: It is a fast paced environment so if you struggle with pressure then this isn't a job for you.

headline: customer service
pros: awesome people, lots of raises, fun place to work, free food, fun outings, and the burgers are amazing
cons: not too may bad things to say, smell like burgers and fries, can be rushed and stressful at times

headline: Line Cook
pros: Good team and great hours, flexible schedule
cons: work was dirty at times and alot of pressure if  you cannot handle it

headline: Former Employee- Level 6
pros: Friendly workers and environment, great pay, teaches a lot like how to multitask and set goals and work fast but efficiently.
cons: Very fast pace and straining on body if full time.

headline: Great Company
pros: Flexible hours, great people all around
cons: you are limited to burgers and fries, have to want to be in the food industry

headline: Decent Company
pros: In-N-Out has a fun company picnic for all of their staff once a year.  They can also work with your schedule so that you can go to school and work relatively easily.
cons: Managers always tend to vary from very good to very bad, and they fluctuate from store to store often.  Be prepared to lose your favorite managers to other stores often.

headline: Great company
pros: Awesome, passionate people. They love their company more than anyone. Pay is great for the fast food industry, and there is always a chance to move up. They work around your schedule which is nice for students.
cons: They're very particular about literally every single detail. This is what makes In N Out great, but it can also get frustrating. The uniform, etc. have to be nothing less than perfect.

headline: Love working here
pros:
They hire the best people. I work with a bunch of goofballs who love to have fun and will make any newbie comfortable.
Free meal everyday. Up to a double-double.
Great caring management that offer constructive criticism.
Great clientele. The people who come to In N Out are all fantastic. 
A company that really cares.
Lots of training. I mean lots. They make sure everything you do is to the highest standard.
cons: Very busy, but hey it is fast food.

headline: Love it
pros: Always busy, time flies, with hard work you move up pretty quickly, everyone is so nice and friendly, great positive atmosphere
cons: Only one 10 minute break on 6 hr shifts. Should be like 15.

headline: Good Job
pros: I enjoyed my time at In N Out, because there are a lot of employees the scheduling is flexible and you get a free burger during every shift!
cons: A lot of people are using In N Out as a career resulting in some power tripping. Its a burger joint!

headline: Great for student
pros: works well with your schedule
cons: high labor intensive job not a lot of breaks

headline: Associate
pros: Company that actually cares about employees. Very professional and constructive atmosphere. Always busy so have something to do constantly.
cons: Faced paced could sometimes be con if you are not into that. You may get tired standing on your feet for a very very very very very long time. But honestly, there were not much cons, working for IN-N-Out was one of the best jobs I could have had.

headline: great for students
pros: Works around schedule, fast pace, time goes by quickly, positive environment
cons: late hours for closing shifts

headline: in n out associate
pros: Great pay. Workers were also very nice. The workers were always willing to help. You get good hours and can move up quickly.
cons: Very fast paced. If you mess up, the boss is quick to blame. They also have very little patience. But a good first job

headline: Never complain about this job
pros: It's like joining a family. Everyone cares about each other, or at least pretends to for the sake of efficient work. Two 10 minute and 1 half hour break for each 8 hr shift, with free meal. Higher ups will keep a watch on your managers too to make sure they're doing their jobs properly, meaning if there was a bad manager they wouldn't last very long. If you're a good learner and team member, this job is a walk in the park.
cons: Listening to others whine about their workload

headline: Anonymous
pros: There are many great things about this company, but my absolute favorite is how care of their employees' well being. In n out is also always taking notice of how the company looks and prioritize the guests' satisfaction. I love working at a place where I share the same values when serving, as well as being taken good care of. I think the quick check process is the holy grail of keeping the employees in line. We are informed every time of what we're doing wrong and how to better ourselves. There is always a goal ahead and the managers are right there beside us to help us reach those goals.
cons: The break is only 10 mins and sometimes I feel like I could choke as I stuff my food down my throat. I understand the need of the staff, especially during peak hours, but I believe they should change it to 15 mins.

headline: Associate
pros: Great company. Management cares. Learned the basics for costumer service. Better pay then average.
cons: Costumes are rude but you still have to treat them like they are right and smile

headline: Great Place to work
pros: It is an amazing company to work for. They really do car abut their employees, and moving up with the company.
cons: I really cant say anything negative at all.

headline: Review
pros:
Great work experience
Free meals during shift
cons:
Long hours
Late nights
Busy busy busy

headline: Good hours but judgemental
pros: The hours are good and the hourly pay is above average. If you like working in a fat pace environment then this would be a good place.
cons: Management is very pushy and your best is never enough. There is a lot of gossip that goes around and a lot of cliques.

headline: Good company
pros: High pay fast paced flexible hours
cons: Hard work long hours late nights

headline: A lot of daily BS
pros: its fun 65% of the time, usually some good people to work with.
cons: A lot of bull issues that happen.. drama, frequent manager changes so you never get comfortable. Company is changing in a much different direction no longer putting any focus on the employee but getting corners to make more money. The is the elite and there is the laborers. With 75% being below 10-15,000, some make about 30,000 with a HUGE gap to 100,000. Sounds fair right?

headline: Busy and Stressful
pros: Get a burger and decent pay
cons: unfair treatment and ask to much for the what they pay

headline: In N Out
pros:
1. we get a free meal every shift 
2. they give you as many hours as you want 
3. they're flexible with schedules 
4. the employees are for the most part very nice
5. they pay great (start at $12 an hour and go up with every level)
6. the working environment is very joyful
7. you learn a lot from working there (skills and values)
cons:
1. they tend to keep you after the time you're scheduled until; if you're working a 5 and a half hour shift, it's almost for sure that you'll be staying for just before 6 hours
2. they're very strict on appearance; your pants have to be sparkling white every single shift or else they may send you home or make you change into extra pants 
3. it's very fast-paced because it's always busy; you'll be exhausted after every shift 
4. we have mandatory store meetings every two weeks at 8am Saturday mornings; they're unnecessary 
5. they don't do a great job of training, a lot of tasks you have to learn on your own
6. the managers can be very pushy and have high expectations of all associates 
7. the uniforms aren't very flattering

headline: Level V
pros: The company prides itself on a team atmosphere. Everyone working a shift was always friendly and amicable. It was an excellent company to work for.
cons: The atmosphere was rather competitive, however this isn't a a con if you appreciate competition.

headline: I would recommend this job
pros: Decent pay, flexible hours, sports tournaments, and free food!
cons: It is a lot of politics. Four different managers and they all have their favorites.

headline: Associate
pros: This is my first job and I couldn't be happier about it. I went through countless job applications where I would never get a response and only two days after I sent in an application online, I got an email inviting me to a group interview for a new store. Everyone that works there is super nice and wants to help you improve because they were all in the same position and we all have a common goal, to satisfy the customer. I love my managers and the people I work with, and the customers.
cons: Breaks are only ten minutes and you are constantly on your feet and never sitting down. Presentation is very important and if there is ever something off, you have to change immediately. But it is all worth it!

headline: Great Company, Great Benefits
pros: In-n-out is great about hiring fantastic people. The environment is hard working and fun. Pay is much better than you'll see at any other fast food chain and they train you for promotions.
cons: You're still flipping burgers.

headline: Great place to start, even keep going
pros: Adjustable schedule, great pay, motivation to advance, great coworkers and atmosphere. Most people I worked with wanted me to succeed and I felt the same for people that joined after myself
cons: Some skills or positions are not easy for everyone to master and you need to master a skill to advance. When I was there management took over 9 months to get to my testing for advancement. My only complaint was the store manager, he was always angry.

headline: Great place super busy
pros: Free burger for every shift
cons: Have to change into uniform at work

headline: Level 3 Associate
pros: Awesome co-workers, going to hockey and baseball games for free almost every month, company picnics, a ton of room for upward movement in the company, FREE BURGERS EVERY SHIFT.
cons: Quality of managers seems to be going down, have to push them constantly to receive training and get promotions, working with customers is always a drag.

headline: Wonderful Company
pros:
Top of the line pay scale
Great management 
Wonderful HR
Great food 
Great bonuses/incentive plans
cons:
Lots of promises about raises.
Mangers coming and going can affect raises
Mangers sometime ignore blatant problems
Working with college kids
Mangers very easily play favorites

headline: in n out
pros: Great friendly environment, advancement oppurtunities
cons: very fast paced, repetitive. straining at times

headline: Keeping it real
pros: Pay and the opportunity to meet some great people.
cons:
Your whole experience is based on the managers being able to handle multiple things at once. A lot of the time managers fold when they head to busier stores and show that they're not ready to be a manager. 
The skill an associate has at a certain level is dependent on opinions usually and this leaves many associates being the same level, but not close to the same skill level.

headline: Level 6
pros: Free meal during shift. 401k vision and Dental benefits and medical(full-time). Flexible schedule, shifts can start as early as 5am (prepping the store for opening) or as late as 9pm (closing). Team oriented and upbeat environment. Young coworkers mostly college students. Potential for exponential growth within the company. Level structure for raises, level 1 - 7. Average of $.75 raise for each level. (Each level differs), each levels consist of different responsibilities and mastering of various positions within the store. Overall fun experience.
cons:
Occasionally 10+ hours shifts without notice.
Some favoritism by managers.

headline: Great Company
pros: Great company to work for. Management takes care of their people. Well structured.
cons: A lot of young high school employees which leads to drama. Easy to stay away from.

headline: In-N-Out Burger
pros: Great opportunities for students and first time workers.
cons: Customers occasionally are difficult to deal with.

headline: Taught me how to work hard
pros: Great atmosphere, great pay. The company really teaches you how to work hard and work in a team atmosphere
cons: You sometimes have to work late hours with not enough employees working so it makes it hard to keep up with quality

headline: Level 6 - Cook
pros:
High Intensity, team-oriented atmosphere
Good pay for high school/college student
Flexible in regards to school schedule
cons:
Hours can vary drastically from week to week
Management not always the most forthcoming

headline: Student Worker
pros: Tons of room for growth and development, career is respectable.
cons: If done as a regular 9-5 to make cash while you're going to school, easy to get overloaded with work pressure that translates into more stress while in school.

headline: Great while going to school
pros: In-N-Out was really flexible while going to school. Pay was also decent when compared to other fast food places. Quality in the ingredients also surpasses that of other burger chains, so I couldn't really complain with the free burger that accompanied my shifts.
cons: Managers seem to play favorites. Raises/promotions can be based on the aforementioned. The atmosphere can sometimes be unprofessional, but I suppose that is normal for the age group of workers.

headline: it was fun
pros: the pros or the job was the pay was great and the job was fun as well. they were helpful and also provide a lot of benefits.
cons: the cons were that other than the online training, they just threw me out on the job and it actually made me really nervous when working. it was so fast paced and it was hard to keep up.

headline: Employment review
pros: Best place to work for hands down.
cons: Hot in the summer. Too many policy changes

headline: overall a great job
pros: friendly environment, great benefits, caring associates, free food, great hours and very open to scheduling, and easy to move up.
cons: fast pace, can get very tired after a 6-8 hour shift

headline: Great customers, Horrible CoWorkers
pros: The pay was absolutely wonderful. Started off at 10.50 an hour. The customers were amazing a lot of the time.
cons: I had rude managers. They thought they were better than a lot of us and the same went for people that were around Level 3 and up. I even had a manager and coworker laugh in my face on the floor when I said I was ready to level up to my level three. Absolutely discouraging. I wouldn't work here again because of the humiliation I dealt with. They can be very biased and turn their heads the other way when longtime workers are bullying the newer staff.

headline: Great Part Time Job
pros:
-Great company. 
-Free meal every shift. 
-The managers are very invested in their careers with the company
-Fun atmosphere that places a great deal of trust on employees.
cons: Not many downsides, great part time job. The hours change a lot, but they can be flexible. Sometimes management makes bad hires.

headline: In n Out
pros: Great Company, Benefits Available, Awesome pay, well taken care of, you may go to school while working, a lot to learn about customer service, a lot of room to grow in the company.
cons: Can be very hard work.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: Motivating environment, great benefits, good company culture
cons: no cons, just depends how much work you put in

headline: Manager
pros: Great benefits and are well taken care of
cons: Hours worked and can be stressful

headline: Associate
pros: Great company to work for, positive environment, great compensation and very hands-on
cons: Sometimes management had difficulty accepting that most part-time employees were just students and did not want to build a career there. Other than that, amazing company!

headline: Associate level 6
pros: Very fast pace environment. Great people to work with.
cons: You grow close to managers and people you work with but since it is not a career people move on and you miss them.

headline: Great Company
pros: Friendly work environment, fun and fast paced
cons: none that I can think of

headline: Excellent Job
pros:
- High Pay: In-n-Out starts at $11/hour and you can work your way to six figures a year
- Team Mentality: This company loves its employees. It knows that every employee is in this with ever other one, and stresses friendship among the employees.
cons: - Difficult to Plan: Management will not hesitate to keep you longer than your scheduled shift if the business needs it.

headline: Associate
pros: Good benefits $12.00 an hour starting with easy promotional opportunities. Many people stay and make a career since store managers make 100k or more. Shift managers make about 20 an hour plus bonuses.
cons: Fast paced environment, must integrate well with their culture to be successful.

headline: One of the Best Companies Out There
pros: They truly care about their employees and the salaries are significantly higher than the industry standard. They are extremely customer-focused and quality is a major priority in every aspect of the company. Benefits are some of the best out there.
cons: No cons. This is a phenomenal place to work.

headline: Good bad bad environment
pros: It was good pay and they are really considerate on your personal schedule they understand that you are a student or family man
cons:
Everyone is so rude and mean it makes working there miserable with all the negative attitude you get for
 Day to day

headline: Great place to work
pros: the food is great, they pay well for min wage job. Great benefits
cons: The weekly hours could increase

headline: ino
pros: good pay and nice people
cons: hard work, stress, low hours, lots of favoritism

headline: Assoicate
pros: Fast pace, strong team, free meals,
cons: Hard work, no chain of command, late hours, not set schedule

headline: Never Quite Felt Like Part of The Team
pros:
Good pay for part timers
Depending on scheduled crew, fun shifts 
Lots to learn
Fast paced
Customers make it worth it
cons:
FAVORITISM FROM MANAGEMENT 
You can work your behind off and the girl the managers liked a lot more gets promoted first
Get stuck on the same positions each shift making it hard to learn enough to move up 
Horrible personal/professional ratio (THIS LOCATION IN PARTICULAR)

headline: In-N-Out Review
pros: Great benefits. I had dental, vision and life insurance as a part time employee. They were very flexible with my schedule. They starting pay is great and you move up fast.
cons: The experience working there depended on the manager. I hated working there whenever the main manger was there but the others were nice and I enjoyed my time there.

headline: great place to work!
pros: fair wages, positive work environment
cons: very busy a lot of the times, but you are well prepared to handle it

headline: Level 4 Associate
pros: Overall exciting place to work. I have met some of my life long friends at this company and the pay helped put me through college.
cons: Your car will smell of onions after each shift.

headline: Worst fun I have ever had
pros: It is very fast paced which helps time go by fast. Free burger everyday so no spending money on food during a break. Workers can be very nice and helpful (AT TIMES). Overall pretty fun environment to work in. Pay is good and hours have been kept up for a while. You learn a lot of news things and a lot of interaction is done.
cons: Everyone teaches you to do things their own ways and then another person gets mad when you don't do it that way. Management almost never says "Thank you",  "Please",  "Goodjob" etc and will ALWAYS point out what they "Would prefer you to do". Always finding the bad out of something you do and can be really frustrating never hearing a "Goodjob, you did that fast!". Anytime you get a "Goodjob", it is followed by a "But can you do this instead of that because blah blah blah" and 90% of the time you get the 2nd part without the "Goodjob".

headline: Level 3
pros: Good pay, Strong Leadership, Opportunities to advance in the company.
cons: Smelling like fries, the uniform

headline: High standards means high labor and stress
pros: Pay is obviously great for fast food service; they advertise it as such.  Free meals every shift and the food is delicious and real.  Atmosphere can be fun and energetic, and customers are usually pretty polite.  Managers can make the job less stressful. These are times when the job is fun.
cons: Workload and stress levels are fairly high, especially as the employee earns higher levels.   Most of the uniform is not provided, and must be paid for and kept exceptionally clean, which is difficult given the messy nature of the food service industry.  Depending on manager, you will be treated well or poorly.  Hours can be high and poor even when requested otherwise for school.  The standards are set subjectively high - one manager's highest priorities will be another's lesser ones, which leads to confusing demands.  Satisfaction with the job is extremely dependent on lower level management and employee treatment.

headline: It's a great company.
pros: Great first job. Raises are pretty regular. Benefits are available for all associates. Honestly, a great company to work for.
cons: It does get busy and customers can be rude. If customer service isn't your thing, then not the job for you.

headline: Great Company to Work For
pros: starting pay is great for a fast food restaurant
cons: a lot of the employees are younger so older applicants may feel out of place

headline: Great place to work
pros: I was very satisfied during my time that I was at In-N-Out. They treated me well and had a good training setup.
cons: Wasn't given exactly what I wanted for scheduling, but it was understandable given that I was a new, temporary employee.

headline: Great Job
pros: Everyone starts at $12 an hour, and they have a very fair and easy levels system for raises. Lots of training.
cons: It's hard to keep the pants clean, but that's about it. It really is a great place to work.

headline: Great pay, ridiculous expectations
pros:
The pay is great and there is availability to move
up since they only hire from within. Coworkers are cool. Free meals when you work. Cool out of work events.
cons: If you aren't ready to be apart of what is essentially a cult, don't bother. I loved working here for the first year or so until I went up in levels. With each level you go up, upper management and those around you get more and more catty and treat you badly. They expect you to eat, breath, and sleep in-n-out. One stipulation when you become full time is that even on your days off you need to be available to come in if someone calls in sick! When you're already working a ton of hours a week and 10 days in a row you're looking forward to that one day you have off, and then you may not get it! If you have good managers things are pretty great, but managers get switched around all the time so you'll eventually be stuck with someone awful, which makes working awful. Plus you will smell like onions no matter how many showers you take. Politics are a big part of this position and of your immediate supervisors don't like you, expect those that they favor to move up before you even if you're a better worker. Plus the rules are RIDICULOUSLY strict. Come on people, it's fast food!

headline: Level 4
pros:
-Great starting wage
-Take care of employees
-Time goes by fast when busy
-Free food!
cons:
-Long hours
-Late nights
-Dealing with large volumes of customers at once

headline: Level 1
pros: Great people to work with, they become your family. Great skills acquired, patience, customer service
cons: The cons are very limited, the schedule is never set, varies every week.

headline: Clean Up
pros:
Set Schedule
Free Meal Every Shift
Carefree Environment (In the early morning)
Unsupervised Work (For first few or so hours)
cons:
Strict Dress-Code
Very High Expectations
Sometime Early Shift Can Be Cumbersome

headline: Awesome
pros: Great benefits, staff, and environment.
cons: If you dont like a fast paced work environment every day, then dont work here.

headline: It's a cool place
pros: It's fast paced and you'll never be bored
cons: They have you stay beyond your scheduled time.

headline: Flexible, Good for college students
pros: Fun, fast pace, free burgers,free events.
cons:
Late night shifts and gets off around 2-3 in the morning
Associates are bullies and manager is a greedy old man.

headline: Great Company
pros: Held fun events outside workplace, great money, great co workers
cons: too much pressure on associates, only ears could be pierced, to showing tattoos allowed, hair had to be a certain length, hard to take time off

headline: In-n-Out Burger
pros: Great benefits such as trips to Disneyland, Picnic events, opportunities for more
cons: Stressful, management can be ridiculous at times, working long hours.

headline: Merchandise Department
pros: They have a very flexible work schedule and are willing to work together and help make a schedule which works. They also provide a very in depth training process which covers all the areas needed to succeed in the job.
cons: a downside would be that levels for advancement only become available after the spot becomes vacant. Rarely do spots open up because of a demand for applicants. It would appear that one can only advance when someone else leaves.

headline: level 5 employee
pros: great fast paced environment, awesome team work , super fun job and always flexible especially if your going to school.
cons: no tattoos, facial hair, piercings

headline: Overall good
pros: fun, team work, new experience, helpful
cons: very busy most of the time, especially during lunch/dinner

headline: Level 7
pros: Great company very flexible with your schedule. Great benefits and associate perks. Room for growth and promotions
cons: Hours fluctuate you work super hard for little pay in the grand scheme of things. You will smell like grease all the time. If you can't multi task and handle high stress environments this is not the job for you

headline: Associate
pros: In-n-Out offers competitive  pay and great flexibility, This is a great place to work as a student.  Its a fast paced environment so the shifts move quickly.
cons: Not a whole lot of cons, the only thing I would say is they have changed there policy on full time employment for non-management and its is near impossible now to earn the great full time benefits I enjoyed.

headline: Meh
pros: Work with great people in a fast-paced environment.
cons: Repetitive, sometimes crappy hours, exhausting

headline: mixed feelings
pros: fun coworkers, good pay, you can move up really quickly
cons: poor organization in management, managers always stressed out, inconsistent hours

headline: Bad HR
pros: Good pay for fast food.
cons: They pretend to be a Christian company but at the end of the day they are more concerned about money. Half the women in my store were sexually harassed by the manager and they decided to just move the manager to a different store and then they told me (I was a minor) to not tell my parents. This was not the first time the manager had been caught.

headline: Level 6 Associate
pros: In N Out has some of the best people in the world working for their company. Definitely lots of perks- (free burgers, nice starting wage, opportunity for growth, annual company events) to be grateful for!
cons: Hours are rough- you can get stuck working a closing shift- 5:30-1:30 and not get out of there until close to 3a.m...and then have to be back at 10a.m. Since INO isn't closed on a lot of holidays, you'll probably get stuck working on a day most companies would have off- Presidents Day, Labor Day, New Years, etc.

headline: Great place to work while in school
pros: The pay is competitive, and they are very flexible about your availability. You work a lot with all the associates so you tend to get close with everyone. The successful operation of the store relies on communication and team which makes everyone feel essential. There is also many opportunities to move up to management if you want it.
cons: You work a lot of late hours and we're very popular so it's always busy which can get very stressful.

headline: Fun, good pay
pros: The pay is incredible, and a free burger at the end of your shift. Time goes by very quickly, because it's usually very busy.
cons:
Customers can be pretty rude and impatient, fellow employees fail to recongize when I'm being yelled at about how I should give them free food, so managers never know and can't help the situation. 
Can be very busy and very stressful at times

headline: Just starting
pros: Very kind and warm managment so far. Im very new but everyone seems to enjoy themselves while working hard. 12$ an hour doesnt hurt either
cons: I cant think of any so far other then its a fast food restaurant which i can only assume means i'll be dealing with some very rude people.

headline: Awesome job
pros: Great environment, always trying to be upbeat despite working hard. Very flexible schedule, somebody can usually cover your shift if something comes up.
cons: not many cons other than sometimes having to work with upset customers or snarky coworkers, but those are very rare

headline: In-N-Out 3rd Manager
pros: Great support, competitive work environment, great job security.
cons: Cutthroat work environment, unattainable standards, underpaid.

headline: Best first job!
pros:
- Dental & Vision benefits for part-time associates
- Flexible hours
- Friendliest environment
- Can be fun & the hours go by fast
- Free food
- Cool awards/gifts
cons:
- Standing on your feet the whole shift
- 10 min break is not long enough

headline: Not enough hours
pros:
Great pay 
Free food
Nice work environment overall
The company itself was like a family with all the events like company sports teams and family day at great wilf lodge.
cons: They are beyound strict. The rules can effect ur life outside of work not many hours given. People steal from you and they wont do anythng about it

headline: An experience I would not trade for the world
pros:
1. Competitive pay: INO leads the charge in the food service industry (ESPECIALLY fast food) for wages.

2. Perks and events: Free burgers and fries, basketball tournaments, bowling tournaments, yearly picnic, Christmas presents, you name it. 

3. The people: some of my closest friends in life were my coworkers at In-N-Out.

4. Amazing experience for future career paths: I worked at In-N-Out to pay for college, but years later, I'm still applying the tenets of this company to my professional life. My experience with concepts like high-quality product, service with a smile and rigid work ethic have translated to professional career opportunities since. 

5. Quality, Friendliness & Cleanliness: These aren't just words that they put on the lap mats and tray liners; they're company doctrine. I will ALWAYS feel comfortable going to In-N-Out to eat. You always hear disgusting horror stories from restaurants about sanitation and health violations, but not here. After five years behind the lines, I have more confidence in this company's food handling and facility cleanliness practices and procedures than any other company in the world. Seriously.
cons: 1. Repetitive motion & posture issues: I'm 6'4" so I had to hunch over to cook French fries 20hrs/week for 5 years. The company promotes a 9-step stretching plan to help prevent these issues, but it needs to be enforced more.

headline: Associate
pros: Hours, Fast Paced, Great pay, easy to move up if you work hard
cons: Long Shifts, Draining work, Multi tasking

headline: Amazing job through high school + college
pros:
Flexible hours, you meet hundreds of people over the course of a few years, great pay, everyone cares so much about the brand and the product, benefits for full-time, company events, holiday activities, store competitions and sports tournaments, regular advancements in level and pay. They want everyone to succeed and continue to grow with the company.

You truly feel like you're part of a family and you learn a level of work ethic that isn't common in the service industry.
cons:
Greasy, you work your tail off, sometimes the pressure of working up to the In-N-Out standard can be stressful and extremely tiring. You'll often leave a shift feeling beat, smelling like grease, and tired as hell. 

Can't have visible tattoos. Can't have piercings beyond the traditional stud (for women only). Can't have unnatural hair color. This is a clean-cut, old fashioned rule.

headline: 3 Year Associate Review
pros: Working at In-N-Out allows you to work with some really cool people. It is a good job if you are in high school or college and want to work with people of a similar age. It also pays well for a first job, so that's a bonus.
cons:
This job requires a lot of hard work. You are expected to show up and give 100% every day. 
Another con is that moving up and getting raises can sometimes be some-what political, rather than merit based.

headline: associate
pros: fast and fun love working there
cons: training is hard to get

headline: in n out has great intentions
pros: great pay, great bosses and great food. this company wants its employees to Want to come to work so they do a really good job creating a good work environment.
cons: the managers will have favorites, if you ever consider becoming manager just make sure to be on all of the store managers good side.

headline: Great job
pros: It is a great place to work at. The salary is good for if you are in school. Most managers work around your schedule.
cons: There is always a lot of drama. It's easy to move up levels in such workplace but because there is no seniority anyone can get ahead.

headline: College kid
pros: Flexible schedule for a college student
cons: Harder to get a cover when in higher levels.

headline: Working at In N Out
pros: The fast paced environment got me ready for my next career move. I really like how flexible they are with the schedule, they know that school is important and will work with you towards your availability.
cons: If you're not a fast learned and can't maintain a great attitude or smile, this isn't the job for you. With having to move around quickly and bumping into each other frequently, make sure this is something you can cope with.

headline: Great job
pros: INO worked with my schedule throughout school. I could request off all the time I needed. They were always understanding. The associates were great.
cons: I smelled like burgers. I would get yelled at by customers when I didn't deserve it.

headline: Store Associate
pros: Plenty of opportunity to move up and a lot of hours.
cons: They work you crazy depending on the store and they play favorites if you want to move up. Isn't as great as it seems.

headline: Do they really care as much as they claim? No
pros:
Pretty good benefits 
Fellow associates are really what make this job
Fun company events
Free burger a day keeps the toned tummy away!
cons: I have worked here a long time and some times it is great but sometimes it is hell. I have worked in various states and some are better than others. Utah being the worst! Arizona and California from my experience have the best upper management. Pay is worth it when you have good managers and Division managers.But you want to kill yourself when you don't. I have seen some of the best people be treated so unfairly and it's like they think we associates don't hear about it! Don't get me wrong company values are great and some of my best friends work here but the is more gossip than highscool!

headline: Divisional Managers have zero accoutablility
pros: Great pay Great atmosphere great training and trips and bonuses.
cons: high school management style, people gossip and talk behind each other backs. Store Managers are complete Hippocrates as well as the divisional manager.

headline: Clean-Up Associate
pros: You work the shift time every week. Flexible scheduling. Young and vibrant group of employees provided for great working environment. If you work hard, it's likely to receive a raise or bonus.
cons: Can be physically demanding at times

headline: A great first job that focuses on training employees
pros: Great training program, opportunities for advancement, free meal when you work, flexible schedule, starting pay for a new hire is $11.00 an hour
cons: When it's really busy, usually the lunch or dinner rush, managers may not be able to get associates off on time so you may have to stay an extra hour or two before they can let you off.

pros: Company benefits. Outings. Nice managers and coworkers. Good place to work if you really like In N Out. Free burger a day.
cons: Small margin of error, very big on accuracy. fast paced, gets stressful at times. Too many burgers can make you fat. Some times the very strict rules are unnecessary.

headline: Level 4
pros: Good pay, good employee appreciation
cons: On your feet for full shift, no downtime

headline: associate
pros: great benefits, good pay, fast environment
cons: very repetitive, can get overwhelming with the huge rushes

headline: Great Company
pros: Flexible Hours, Great staff, great management, lot of room for growth
cons: Be ready to handle stress well

headline: Terrible management and co workers
pros: Quitting, the  manager getting fired for sexual harassment, the free meal at the end of the shift
cons: The people who run it, the unset schedules, the phoniness, smelling like a burger

headline: anonymous
pros: Very flexible schedule, great pay and benefits
cons: Takes a bit to get used to the fast paced environment

headline: It's alright, but it's very demanding and stressful at times
pros: The pay is great and most of the people that come in are very nice and the staff is usually nice and helpful
cons: Costumers are very picky about food and it's very fast paced. It is packed most of the time and there is no room for any mistakes.

headline: Level 3
pros: Free food, decent pay, ok uniforms
cons: Management can think their all thatg

headline: Great job
pros: Good pay, flexible hours, great training
cons: Stressful, fast paced, hierarchy, late hours

headline: Okay place
pros: Great pay. Free food.Co workers are fun and most managers are helpful.
cons:
Understaffed. When ever someone calls out they text you if they need. You isn't that illegal to text. They over ride your availability and schedule you days you can't work at. I thoght in n out was supposed to be a fun place to work at. But its stressful, some people are really rude, and cooks think they are all that. Definetely not staying here for more than 6 months 
Would not recommend

headline: Level 3 Associate
pros:
Probably the best fast food place to work.

Pay is good
Benefits are good
You get treated very well and the environment is usually very fun
cons:
If you want to transition into management you generally have to go to a different store.
You must be a fast learner.

headline: Level 3 Associate
pros: Great work environment, good communication, lots of opportunities to move up.  Flexible schedule especially for students, awesome full-time benefits.
cons: Can be hectic at times but becomes easy after working a decent amount of busy shifts.

headline: Associate
pros: This was a great place to work. Great leadership and business in general. They always take great care of all the employees.  Very fun atmosphere!
cons: I have nothing negative to say.

headline: Was Good Job
pros: Nice Lenient and very nice
cons: Strict sometimes and can be scary

headline: DO IT
pros: INO provides a wonderful team-oriented atmosphere to work in. Its a company that truly cares about their employees and makes a point to show that.
cons: It can be incredibly stressful sometimes so if you don't do well in fast-paced environments or with multitasking, it might not be the right fit for you. However, the job is incredibly rewarding so if you want to work hard to get your job done correctly, this is the place to be!

headline: Fun Part-Time Job
pros: A wonderful company culture and really fun part-time work. They were very flexible about having to schedule around school, good pay and even good benefits- what other part-time foodservice job has a 401k with a percentage match?
cons: Strict grooming standards mean no long hair or beards- understandable because of the food safety reasons those standards exist. Thought it was silly to have to cover tattoos, but not a big deal.

headline: Level 4
pros: Great pay, great holiday parties, great co-workers from part-time to career. It's a great career if you make it into one, they make good money.
cons: depends on the location but sometimes there weren't enough people to do the closing shift.

headline: Good place to work if you can handle the physical demand
pros: great pay, starting wage is around $11.00. mostly friendly atmosphere. Flexible scheduling, can pretty much call in sick for any reason. FREE FOOD!!  Very fast advancement, if you're a quick learner.
cons: slow days and low team energy make it boring. puts a lot of stress on your body if you are not physically tough and naturally high-energy. sometimes scheduled twice in the same day, (ex. closing shift ending at 2 am, and then coming back at 7 or 8 am.) super repetitive type of job, body aches are a daily battle.

headline: All else fails, I still work at In N Out (:
pros: Very fast paced so shifts will fly by. I currently go to school full-time and they are very flexible when i need to take time off for big assignments or if I want to go home for the weekend, etc. Free burgers, fries, and shakes (when working) eeeeeekkkk!!
cons: If you have open availability you might work really late. If it doesn't work for you, try to talk to manager and work something out.

headline: My time
pros: Great company right out of school, good pay and benefits.
cons: No cons, the company is great

headline: Level 5 Associate
pros: flexible around schedules, pay well, fun atmosphere, easy to move up positions.
cons: The hours are hard to keep up with.

headline: Great Company
pros: Food is great, the people are nice, and the pay is leaps and bounds higher than most restraunts.
cons: There really aren't many cons, the company is great, you get plenty of benefits and the pay is amazing.

headline: Double double for days
pros:
Good people
Company seems to care about you
Company and store parties 
A free burger every shift you work
Good pay
Requirements for advancement are very clearly laid out and obtainable
cons:
Can be stressful working a busy weekend 
You will smell like a fryer or grill
You will burn yourself
You will work with idiot high school kids
Some of the management can be pretty incompetent

headline: In N Out
pros: Fast paced environment, great people, awesome pay and really good benefits
cons: hours of operations, smelling like burgers

headline: Level 5 Associate
pros: Great, fast-paced environment never leaves you bored. I loved my coworkers. It can be a great part-time job during school or you can move up into management pretty fast. For an entry level food service job, it has great starting pay.
cons: Wearing goofy outfits and smelling like a burger after your shift was over.

headline: Store Associate
pros: You get paid higher than the minimum wage. Everyone's really nice to you. Fast paced job so work goes by really quickly.
cons: If you work the closing shift, you're often guaranteed to get off work earliest by 2am. It's expected especially if you're working in the restaurant business.

headline: Level1
pros: Really take care of associates
cons: Job rotation doesn't always occur

headline: good
pros: you get to pretty much name your schedule
cons: part time so u only get a 10 minute break

headline: Great company
pros: Great company to work for with high standards and core values. They take care of their people and expect you to do the same for the customers
cons: Very strict grooming policies. Request offs around holidays can be difficult.

headline: Fantastic Company
pros: Fantastic Company, valued employees immensely
cons: you want to stay forever

headline: Fun and rewarding. Upper management really acknowledges good work ethic and trains with patience.
pros: Full benefits for full timers. Dental and vision for part timers. 401K plan offered, as well as associate assistance program and vacation and sick pay. Free meal every time you work. The company really cares about their associates.
cons: Sometimes considered hard labor and may work long hours on weekends and weekend nights. Other than that didn't really have much to be dissatisfied about.

headline: Get ready for people to yell at you
pros: Good pay for high school student.
cons: Management can be stressful to work with.

headline: Great job
pros: Good for young people who want to work hard and earn more than the rest of the quick service restaurants, good incentives, great managers and culture
cons: Not really much negative to say, it is tough at times but it's because our standards are so high, hours vary but that's everywhere in the restaurant industry

headline: Great first job
pros: Flexible schedule. They want you to move up in the company. Frequent rewards for not getting injured.
cons: Late nights. Days can go by slow.

headline: Decent for High School and Mid-College
pros: Free meals, vacation pay, great work environment, fast-paced, work rewards (Picnics, dinners, boat cruises, etc.)
cons: Almost never off when scheduled, play favorites, no facial hair, strict with hair, eating too many burgers and fries

headline: Love
pros: Tiring but I love the job
cons: It can be fast-paced and sometimes energy draining

headline: Great if you love working
pros: Amazing coworkers, you'll always be busy, good wages and very easy to get a raise, free burgers and fries along with other rewards (safety prizes, etc)
cons: Might of just been my store, but hours were too intensive for what I needed despite asking management for otherwise, kept late almost every night.  Can't go to classes and work five night shifts a week, especially when they don't stick to schedule.  Called in almost every day off.  They put managers in training in charge almost every shift, even if they can't do a good job with what's going on

headline: Great Company
pros: Great people and great atmosphere. Everyone starts from the bottom and works your way up. You get what you put into the job. Learn the essentials from communicating to team work. Also learn how to problem solve.
cons: Fast paced and always on your feet. Only get ten minute breaks. Sometimes not enough associates working which makes for a stressed environment.

headline: What is the future?
pros: Powerful brand. Incredible operations oriented company. Company pays well. Corporate culture not the same or as good as store culture.
cons: It will be interesting to see what the owner does with the company when she gains full control in a few years. Management not always aligned. Growth will either be their be downfall or ....

headline: Associate
pros: Great company, works with schedule
cons: Late hours, open on hoildays

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Great benefits, fun company parties, reasonable salary, and friendly people to work with!
cons: None that I can think of

headline: I LOVED working for this company!
pros: Fantastic management. Great pay. Fun environment.
cons: Hours, you never really know when you'll get off.

headline: In-N-Out
pros: In-N-Out pays very well and gives decent hours for Part-time employment. I learned better communication skills and how to work with a team. You learn how to multitask and work under stressful situations.
cons: Working there was VERY stressful and tiring. Many of the upper-levels would treat the lower-levels very badly and even yell at you. It's also extremely difficult to level up in certain positions and takes forever.

headline: Loved working at In N Out
pros: Great coworkers, In N Out prides itself on being a family atmosphere and it totally is, consistent schedule/hours, really great pay
cons: Always busy, so you don't get much down time, 10 minutes for a break

headline: Crew Member
pros: It was a great and friendly environment. There is always smiling going around and the management always make sure to make the day as best as they can.
cons: The downsides about working there are that the schedule is always changing. So you never really know when your are working that month.

headline: After working here for about 2 years
pros:
Good pay for entry-level job
Friendly coworkers and management
Many opportunities for better pay
Ability to keep moving up in positions
Company events for employees
cons: Closing can be less than ideal for someone that doesn't want to work until two or three in the morning.

headline: Level 7
pros: Great work environment, busy, and plenty of room for growth
cons: Compensation is great, but only if you're willing to go into management.

headline: Great Company
pros:
Good pay
Flexible schedule
Work is fun and gives practical life experience
cons: Sometimes the managers get stressed out, which can make you stressed out. Politics can mandate who gets training and who doesn't.

headline: level 5
pros: you will love it
cons: its way to much fun

headline: Good place to start career, lousy place to stay long term
pros:
As a young person, they really instill the perfection needed to succeed and the value in providing exceptional service. Sure the starting salary is above minimum wage, but keep in mind that's a low standard. 

Once you're an Assistant (2nd) or store manager, you're making good money. Also, if you can get on the travel team, you work long hours and make good money while having little time to spend it. 

By far the best experience was traveling on the all-star team. It was fun, fast-paced and you typically were given more responsibility while there. 

Plenty of women are promoted, though this can be a con (see below)
cons:
Too many, but here's a basic list:

1. Was sent by the company to another location for 2 months. My medical care benefits package was sent to my home store so I didn't receive them until WEEKS after the deadline to enroll.... you guessed it, HR would not let me enroll even after my store manager called and told them it was his fault. Nope. So I went without medical insurance when I really needed it for a year. 

2. closed minded management: We often opened earlier than our official sign so customers would walk up early but then walk away even though we were opened. I proposed an 'Open' sign... something very simple, yet the idea was rejected, only to be picked up by the new manager shortly after i left. very small problem but we were losing about $200+ in sales every week. 

3. Sexual harassment and apathy. I complained many times about many issues. it was ignored. 

4. Caught a manager with prior problems such as partying with associates (big NO)  with weed INSIDE the store, nothing happened. 

5. the actual sexism in the particular district I was in for a short time. Women were promoted and the men were treated as inferior 

6. ridiculous write ups.  Never had problems with any managers but one manager decided to write me up for something that was not against policy after agreeing to something with me. sorry it's vague but can't give any more details 

6. Numbers over customer service. lower level managers typically work the night shift. Have you ever been at a store around 9-11pm and the service is super slow? The lower level managers have to make their labor marks and without question will always let people off work. It's bad enough that people are tired of it, but not bad enough to call customer service. 
It was bad when I worked there and it's terrible now even recently. 

7. Family/social life: I estimate that about 80% or more of my store and district managers all cheated on their spouses with someone at the company at some point. The hours are really rough. It's not bad if all your friends work at INNOUT but it was nearly impossible to have a social life outside of your innout friends once you reached a certain age. for kids, it's ok. 

8. Once during a management meeting I had a high level executive comment on how he admired McDonald's fries for their consistency... never mind the fact that we were serving fresh fries and McD's serves fries with TONS of chemicals in it. I mentioned it during the meeting, and he looked dumbfounded... this is a guy making $xxx,xxx a year too

headline: Associate
pros: Good Pay, Opportunities for advancement, Friendly Coworkers, Fun place to work, Fast Paced environment
cons: Unpredictable hours, On call all the time- If you don't pick up extra shifts then management will not be fond of you

headline: Level 4
pros: Free food, great people to work with, fast paced, great starting rate
cons: Don't receive tips, political based system with a lot of kissing up

headline: Friendly environment with opportunity for development
pros: One of the highest entry starting pay jobs in the fast food industry with many opportunities to develop and grown within the company.
cons: Some of the challenges include working long days and even longer nights. Very fast paced environment with little help during night shifts.

headline: I love in n out burger everything is so amazing
pros: Great pay, easy to advance, great people, very team oriented, and lots of fun.
cons: You have to be constantly moving and doing job duties

headline: Perfect student job
pros: I liked working at in n out for awhile while attending college.  It has a good minimum wage compared to most places.
cons: Management has some authority issues, which should be addressed because everyone works really hard for not much room to step up the ladder.

headline: Great full time benefits
pros: Good pay for a fast food restaurant.
cons:
Growth depends on favoritism.
Can be hard work if at a very busy store.

headline: I have worked at In N Out for 2 years and am a level 4 working on my level 5 board raise.
author_position: In N Out Associate Level IV
pros: The best thing is that we get Thanksgiving, Christmas, and Easter off with 4 hours pay for those days. In addition, the benefits are great and the company parties and activities are a great plus.
cons: It is a very stressful and fast paced environment. After a while you learn that they don't mean anything personal and yelling is just a daily thing.

headline: Great job, but pretty stressful
pros: Great coworkers, great pay, usually very flexible with scheduling.
cons: Training is very inconsistent at times depending on location. Had been thrown into positions without receiving proper training.

headline: Takes care of employees
pros: Great pay and great benefits. Paid vacation time depending on how long you've been with the company. Really upbeat atmosphere with lots of fun people. Paid time off for Easter, Thanksgiving, and Christmas and an awesome company sponsored family picnic every summer. Our region went to the water park in Concord, they take over the whole place for two days. Lots of opportunities for advancement, they really value training and getting everyone to move as high in the company as they can.
cons: Hit or miss with the management. Most managers, both in store and corporate, have been with the company since they were teenagers, and have little experience outside the company. Because of this, you are working for lots of people who have only ever worked with teenagers, and were trained by people who have worked there since they were teenagers. A lot of pettiness in the way problems get handled. Kind of a cult mentality when it comes to the company.

headline: Very fun
pros: Very fun atmosphere, good pay, and team members treat you well. I recommend this job to anybody who is outgoing and loves the fast paced environment.
cons: Stressful hours and shifts. Short breaks and customers nagging at you sometimes. It was definitely rough at first but you eventually get used to it.

headline: INO
pros: Great company to work for! Easy to progress through the levels of the company while learning how the business works as you move along. Thanksgiving and Christmas off -- which was a plus.
cons: Besides wearing a hat and not being able to wear a pony tail or have tattoos, I can not think of many cons to working at in n out burger

headline: Games
pros: It's a family ran business
cons: Working there is like being in high school.  You have to try out for everything and you are judged on your actions.

headline: Great part time job
pros: Friendly coworkers, flexible schedule, fast pace environment (you're ALWAYS doing something)
cons: You have to learn things quickly and keep up with rush hours

headline: I am grateful to be a part of In-N-Out
pros:
Flexibility
Fast Paced
Position Rotation(So you don't get bored)
Training Simulators Help a lot
Trainers don't just stand around.
cons: Wearing really big shirts because the smaller sizes run out quick.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Holidays off, flexibility of schedule, work place morals and values. The company really cares about their employees and offers room for advancement and growth.
cons: Sometimes it can be a bit like high school because it is a lot of people's first time job, but you work through it.

headline: Great company. Bad choices of management.
pros: Great benefits given to all associates who work for this company. Great pay for a fast food chain. Provides a free meal every shift.
cons: Management does not handle employees well. They let their emotions overcome their actions a lot of the times and care more for toxic criticism rather than constructive criticism and improvement. This is coming from not only from my store.

headline: Nice company
pros:
Good benefits
Good people
Good vibes
cons: When it's super busy and we need more people to work

headline: Former employee/manager of 5 years
pros: Teaches employees INCREDIBLY hard work, to pay attention to detail, to make the customer #1.  Great coworkers and product.  Lots of opportunity for advancement.
cons: Impossibly high expectations for employees.  Even perfection is flawed.  This is a bit hard on the ego of a perfectionist.  Long hours, bonuses for outstanding work are rare if they occur at all.

headline: Best First Job
pros:
Free Meal every shift you work.
Great Benefits. 
Rewards from the company.
cons:
Rude Customers
Not much else.

headline: Store Associate
pros: Free meal, nice associates, disneyland if safety goal met
cons:
High work always
Time consuming to rise in position

headline: Great Company
pros: Great pay, Great Schedule, Great benefits, Great People
cons: Smell, Breaks, heat, flexible daily positions

headline: Doesn't live up to the hype
pros:
-A decent minimum wage for someone without a college degree
-Free meal every time you work
cons:
-Be prepared to work your tail off for 8 hour shifts
-Very hot in the stand
-Basically slave labor
-Lots of drama between associates

headline: Hard work
pros:
One free burger for everyday that you work.
Lots of diversity
Fast paste atmosphere, so time flys.
The pay
cons:
Unfair management
Extremely unprofessional managers
Lots of favoritism
The hours can be horrible

headline: Working here is very fun!
pros: Good pay, fun environment. I really love working there. I look forward to going to work. I never pictured work as fun until I got hired there.
cons: Rude customers, but you can get that anywhere. This store just deals with tourists in particular.

headline: Level II
pros: They really take care of you and make you get everything you need and there is a huge emphasis on customer service.
cons: They could work more with the associates that have never worked in fast pace environment so that they can get the help they need.

headline: Happy Associate
