pros: Pay, hours, benefits, company associate appreciation, bonuses, incentives, the list goes on and on. Coolest president ever.
cons: The associates who don't appreciate what we have. Other than that nothing

headline: Best place for a part-time job especially for students
pros: The managers are great. They happily work around any complicated schedule and they give you any time off you request as long as it's at least 3 weeks notice. They train you on many positions in the store and give raises frequently.
cons: My only problem comes from some other coworkers. My store tends to be clicky and gossipy. Some of the higher levels treat the lower levels like dirt.

headline: Typical food service job
pros: The company has great training, very flexible schedules, and does a lot for their employees such as Christmas gifts and their annual picnic for associates. Fast paced work so time goes by quicker. Pay is awesome.
cons: Work becomes very repetitive. Management is changing so they micromanage everything now. It is no longer a fun job. Nearly everyone gets carpal tunnel in the higher levels.

headline: Amazing
pros:
Pay is amazing... no other company pays as well as In n Out
People are nice and cheerful, the energy here is postive
Words can't describe enough how great this job has impacted my life
cons: Can't accept tips... which I think is ridiculous

headline: Very busy and face paced and very fun and possibilities for advancement.
pros: Face paced, good pay, flexible, fun, benefits, store rewards, advancement opportunities. The people who work there are great and generally very young.
cons: If you don't take it seriously, you won't get that many hours or can get stuck without advancing. Sometimes there is a lot of favoritism.

headline: Awesome Career with no degree required
pros: I had very friendly coworkers. If you stick with it and work hard, the management track pays well. The company pays for recreational sports tournaments against other stores as well as an annual trip to an amusement park. You also get free food every shift so you spend a lot less on food per week.
cons:
Assistant Managers and Managers in training are put under a lot of pressure. Some of these people did not handle the stress well and employees on their shifts were treated poorly because of it. 
Also, the job is tough from day 1. There is a lot to learn and you are constantly being trained in new positions. This can be very stressful because since you are always learning you very rarely have an easy shift doing something that is easy for you.
Last, I was very tired after almost every shift. This job takes a lot of energy out of you.

headline: Level 5
pros: great work environment, pretty busy so times goes fast, working with great people
cons: a little too militant/tyrannical in its management style at times

headline: Level 5
pros: Pros... Ummmm. The only pros are the benefits. The 401k and benefits for the part time associates are amazing, really they are.
cons: I think I really laugh when everyone says they pay is great. $10.00-12.00 working in 100 degree heat slaving away all day is not great pay. The starting wage for fast food is better than most, sure, but you can't live off of $12 an hour unless you're a HS or college student living with family or working full time. Not working 20 hours per week. Not in Cali. The favoritism between management is ridiculous. It's starting to get amusing and after awhile the pieces of the puzzle all start coming together. You realize who is sleeping with you to get to the position they're at and that's the way it goes.

headline: Good Job
pros: Very good pay and very good scheduling
cons: Hard work and management can get a bit annoying

headline: Great for students and teenagers
pros:
I started when I was 16 and I made more money than all my friends with jobs.  I know I'd have good work ethics no matter what but In N Out does make you proud of that.  There's always something to do and always something to improve on. 
Overall its a great company to work for.
cons:
You always here In N Out pays so well but I honestly think that's just the store managers.  I think associates should get paid more or be able to receive bonuses if they excel.  I worked way too hard for years and never got rewarded except for a small paycheck.  I do think I was at the wrong store at the time with awful managers that took advantage of me.  Now I'm at a new store and I refuse to work that hard.  It's not worth it to me and I don't ever want to feel that unappreciated again.
I am slightly bitter at the company for my bad experience at my first store.  I believe the store manager should of been fired a lot time ago for treating people the way she does. 
Putting a complaint into HR makes no difference since its IN N Out's HR.  Some associated did call HR and nothing happened.  She's still working for the company and actually is at a busier store now making more money.  Maybe she's changed but I highly doubt it.

headline: Administrative Assistant
pros: Nice family culture, great pay and benefits. Company shows associate appreciate through many company sponsored events.
cons: Sometimes it's who you know not what you know or how hard you work.  Sacrifice of personal time and family is a common occurrence.

headline: Customer Service
pros: Great place to learn the ropes of providing excellent customer service and working in a fast paced environment. Very team-oriented
cons: Sometimes management differs and its hard to follow the pacing to each manager's liking.

headline: Good starter job.
pros: Good starting pay for a starter job, out of jobs in fast food it certainly pays better than most. Great benefits even for part-time workers such as 401k plan and paid vacation time.
cons: Not many hours available, often working shifts from 11:00am-3:00pm so your day is cut right in half without you earning any real money for a shift. Its better if you get an earlier shift if you want more hours, you also get off earlier.

headline: loved working there in my teenage years
pros: In N Out was full of great people, super flexible hours, happy customers and an enjoyable environment
cons: I really don't think there are many cons working at In N Out. Just like any other gig, the job is what you make of it.

headline: In-N-out Burger
pros: Good company to work for as a college student.
cons: During the summer hours get cut

headline: Good company to work for
pros: WOrk with schedule super friendly benefits
cons: shorts hours. 3 4 6 8 hour shifted

headline: Good Company, Stressful Job
pros: Good compensation, managers are flexible with working around your school and personal schedule, time goes by fast. I love all of my coworkers. Free burger and fries on your shift, which can be positive or negative haha.
cons: Hot and stuffy work environment, goofy looking work outfits, hair up in a ponytail/hat gave me headaches, never a second to take a breather and relax. Constantly in motion and on your feet. Customers sure can be a pain.

headline: cook
pros: been working for 6 years. got to my hourly rate after about 3 and a half years of work.
cons: it is fast food and ultimately it is embarrassing at times. but you do make decent money for it

headline: Lvl 3
pros: You have a great learning experience as a young person starting out there. Looks very good on resume.
cons: DO NOT STAY! Work for a period of time find a better job then leave. Pay is good but other places are better.

headline: Solid Job
pros: The employees at the store i was at was very friendly on my first day on the job. The management is great, most managers are friendly you have one or two who are not the greatest but the management is still overall great. There are sometimes extremely kind customers who appreciate your service.
cons: It is not rare that you have to deal with rude, impatient, and unaware customers. They sometimes can be a pain.

headline: Fast pace environment constant work can't stop to breath without management shouting at you to do something else.
pros: Company is so busy that hours are available for ppl who are higher levels.
cons: Knowing I'm going to work to do the same thing everyday is demoralizing

headline: Cashier
pros: Good pay and great co workers
cons: Alienation in a fast pace work environment

headline: Associate
pros: Great Company to work for.
cons: No Cons for store 213 in Sacramento, CA

headline: Associate Level 2
pros: The pay is very good with lots of opportunities for raises.  Flexible hours.  Friendly, family atmosphere.  Associates are treated very well.  Benefits available.  The company also funds a charity.
cons: If you are a regular associate starting out at level one, you have to work part-time.  Later on, you can get the opportunity to work full-time.

headline: Level 5
pros: Great communication with management ( depending on the store ). Ive found the company to be very flexible when it comes to meeting the needs of employees ( scheduling, etc)
cons: rate of hours and as a result YOUR salary depends on the rate of business. In N out is generally busy and obtaining hors for a decent sized paycheck isnt an issue usually , but several months of the year when business is " slow" times get tough.

headline: Great starting job
pros: Great working staff, the management was always somewhere near you if there was a problem and the food was amazing.
cons: Very fast paced for someone just coming into the food industry, always busy, never really any down time to rest.

headline: Amazing company
pros: i love how close you are to everyone and how nice all of my associates are. the company truly cares for all its associates and makes each and everyone of us feel special.
cons: Working nights and weekends is a definite requirement, can be extremely fast paced. (Not always a bad thing)

headline: Not for slackers
pros: free food, long lasting friendships, great pay, learn how to work hard, competitive raises, flexible hours
cons: the more you level up, the more you feel taken advantage of. can be very stressful, a lot of favoritism.

headline: Level 2 Associate
pros: Good pay. That's the only reason I worked hard and put up with their bull crap for almost a year.
cons: Where do I begin? I thought working at In N Out would be fun, exciting and a great learning experience. It isn't. Working at In N Out is like being in high school all over again. Managers have favorites, higher up levels are snobby and will pick on you for the smallest mistakes. When you're first starting to learn order taking and you get tiny mistakes wrong, you'll get called back every time for a chat about what you're doing wrong, and they'll make you feel like crap. If you don't bleed In N Out, you're not considered a priority associate, even if you do work hard. Everyone is fake. There are the people who are die hard In N Out associates that kiss up to managers, and those who work hard, but can't move up because they're not on the managers' favorite list. In my year of working there, I never once got off in time. They never follow the schedules. Managers also love to play the guilt card and persuade you to work longer hours because they either want to go home, or they let someone off too early and now you have to pay the price. Managers are jokes. They're basically just higher paid associates with a lack of understanding about business. They also get switched around stores a lot which makes it very hard to get comfortable with a manager you like. Moving up levels at In N Out is easy if you want to give up your life. If you're not working at least 5 days a week, you're nothing important. It's also hard to work 5 days a week to begin with because they hire SO MANY PEOPLE ALL THE TIME. In N Out never stops hiring. I was lucky I was in the first hire group of last year, and started off with 4 days a week. But with all the new hires, I got to 1 day a week and basically had to beg others to let me cover their shifts. Bottom line is: This place sucks. In N Out is great to their customers but horrible to their associates. This place is run like a dictatorship and is very unfair. So glad I stopped working there.

headline: General manager
pros: Family oriented and very well paid with benefits
cons: You have to give up quality of life for success

headline: review title
pros: Love the friendly customers, love the atmosphere.
cons: some of the complaints make you feel bad if you took the order

headline: Level 6 cook
pros: Lots of benefits and high job security.
cons: Long hours, toll on your body, standing all day. Late night hours

headline: associate
pros: Decent pay, felixable schedule for high school and college student, team building atmosphere
cons: Over worked, high management out of touch with store employees, higher ups make decisions without understanding the effects that they might have on the employees who run thier stores

headline: Great First Job
pros:
Starting Pay
Easy to move up
Nice shifts
Company Parties
cons:
Some late nights
Easier to know someone at store to get an interview

headline: Level 3 Associate
pros: Hours, Pay, Free Meals, Coworkers, company benefits such as insurance and parties
cons: Customers, managers are always trying to get people to work more hours than what was said, some management have no idea what theyre doing

headline: Prepare to get worked
pros:
Here I learned what hard work is. I learned to value my work ethics and because i stayed at in n out for over a year, Many places I have applied to will give me an interview.
Pay is good and the perks are also good. You "level-up" quickly and with every level is a pay raise.
cons: it can be stressful when its busy (most of the time). The managers are all very nit-picky.

headline: Fast paced action
pros: Flexible hours, fast paced environment, understanding managers. Clear expectations and frequent review for promotion.
cons: Hours are few and meant to keep you as a part-time associate. You will not be able to become full-time unless you're level 6/7 (at my location) associate. Part-time status was meant to comply with California health insurance laws and keep In-N-Out from having to offer it to more associates.

headline: Very Good Job
pros: Very good job to work at recommend it
cons: Cant work full time unless youre going into Management , which can take at least 2 years

headline: In n out
pros: Great pay, strict work environment
cons: Fun place to work but stressful management always changing etc

headline: In N Out Review
pros: Develops you as a person and instills discipline.  Where other companies might frown upon your ambitions because other managers are jealous In N Out invests in you.
cons: This job is extremely attentive to detail.  Prepare for a lot of feedback.  Be ready for constructive criticism.

headline: Great pay - Strict on uniform and high on standards
pros: Great starting pay and they let you ramp up quickly. With each new "skill" you master comes a pay raise (i.e. fry cook, grill)
cons: Very strict on uniform and appearance. Had to come in early to change into uniform but didn't get paid for that extr time. They have lockers but most of them were broken and you need to provide your own lock (if the latch wasn't broken) Never had enough uniforms in your size available. Visible tattoos, piercings not allowed not is "unnatural" hair color or makeup.

headline: High pay!!!
pros: Nice, reputable company, very clean and fast paced.
cons: Must like fast paced environment. Very high standards!

headline: My Take
pros: INOB takes care of their associates with pay/salary and perks.
cons: As a corporate associate you are not able to use your skill set/experience.  Its a" do as they say environment".

headline: Great place!
pros: I don't have any prior jobs to compare this to as its my first job but I truly like it. The people in the business are actually really sweet and friendly and the company genuinely seems to care about the employees. (which I was told prior to my first real day and I was like "lol yeah okay that's a load of bologna you guys probably care more about the money" but I was actually somewhat shocked when they proved true to their word. I mean, I'm sure they care about the money but they also care about the costumer AND the employee. Something not a lot of places seem to.) The pay is amazing and the managers are really accommodating to employees schedules- a lot of us are juggling classes and even other jobs and they're more than willing to work with us with our schedules (there are a few coworkers I know of who are never scheduled to work on Sunday's because of Church and what not; again, something not a lot of places would do) and I always feel like I can talk to my managers about something without fear. It's also a really positive environment to work in and it's almost like a tight knit family; I actually trust each person I work with. I could go on and on about the pros of working for In-N-Out but then I'd never stop typing. Basically, great company, wonderful people, and I'm honestly so lucky and grateful that I'm able to be a part of this company.
cons: I think that there's this misconception that working in the fast food industry is incredibly easy which isn't the case-especially at In-N-Out. There's always, ALWAYS something to do so you're constantly on the move (the first few days were a killer on my feet I'm not even joking). You have to maintain a quick pace, as it's almost like a machine; if one person falls behind on their job, it could slow the whole system down. Sometimes you'll have nothing to do and then other times, you'll be so swamped with orders that you're going nonstop for HOURS (I'm not even exaggerating, I just got off my shift and the drive through was packed for over three hours). Also-and this doesn't happen a lot- but you'll get a rude costumer every now and then, so if you can't be patient and kind, then I wouldn't apply to In-N-Out. Honestly, patience and kindness are two very important qualities needed for this job as you're going to need to practice it...a lot. Honestly, there really aren't a lot of cons though. Like I said, it's a pretty good company.

headline: this place sucks
pros: getting breaks and getting paid
cons: a lot of the managers are fake.  they are not your friends.  do not trust them.  every day is an awesome opportunity to get written up.  pretty much all of the employees at my store were written up at some point.  i'm so glad i left.  i don't think i would have minded getting fired though.

headline: In N Out Associate (Level 5)
pros: People are very friendly to work with and more than willing to help you out, the pay is wonderful for the job and duties you perform daily, and every now and then the company holds great events for its associates to attend
cons: Can tend to be physically demanding (standing for long hours at a time, heavy lifting, over exertion, easily gets overheated/burned while preparing foods)

headline: In-N-Out Burger Experience
pros: The pay is great and part-time associates are offered good hours and fun perks.
cons: Management can expect you to make In-N-Out your life, which jeopardizes social life and the high expectations can make the environment stressful at times.

headline: Good place to start for sure!
pros: I work there to earn money while on college. The fact that they pay a high entry level wage compared to other similar jobs is definitely a big plus while attending college. The work environment is very friendly and management is very understanding of each individual's circumstances. My manager is very comprehensive of my class schedule, which is really important. You need no experience as long as you have the desired attitude, which is a pro over many restaurant jobs, where the decent paying ones usually require prior work in the field. It is easy to move up as long as you learn quickly.
cons: It is very fast paced in general, and sometimes painfully so during extremely busy days, which happen often. This is mainly due to the fact that it is the only In n Out in the city (SF) and that it is not a particularly big store. You are not allowed to receive tips, which means that although the starting wage is high, the monetary advantage over being waiter can disappear over time. At least at the SF store, there are a lot of things to deal with which might not be pleasant regarding homeless people and customers with bad attitude.

headline: Love my job!
pros: You would get free burgers when you would work! The pay is fantastic and they want you to move up quickly to get your raise!
cons: It can be hard at first because of the long hours standing up, but after the first few weeks you get used to it!

headline: Great place to work
pros:
It teaches you hard work 
Team/family environment
Flexible hours for school or family
cons:
The heat 
10 + hr shifts

headline: Great Company to Work For
pros: Great company to work for. Flexible scheduling around family life and schooling. Lots of room for advancement
cons: Fast Paced Work--Not for the lazy

headline: All about the politics...
pros: Great pay to do nothing really.  Free food on every shift.  Some of the people are pretty cool, it all depends on which store you are at.
cons: Management is horrible.  pretty much anyone can be a manager as long as you put the time in.  This might seem good but it puts people in management that have no business being there.  The level of favoritism that happens there is ridiculous.  The favorites get moved into management, the employees resent them because they see how it works, and then they hate them because they become horrible managers.  The cycle goes on.  Hire crap managers, they train crap managers.  The pay is basically hush money, it's enough to keep you quiet.

headline: Associate
pros:
Always busy.
Great people.
Great training and development planning.
Company-wide or sponsored events (bowling, softball, soccer, basketball, golf tournaments, picnics, Christmas parties, Disneyland trips)
Benefits, for part time too.
Flexible scheduling.
cons:
Physically demanding
Depending on your division our region, management turnover can be somewhat high. 
Inconsistency scattered throughout a few levels of management.
Lots of policies to learn, and that are constantly changing. (After about 3 months it's definitely not bad anymore).

headline: Amazing place to work and learn
pros: Great management, generally strong unit of people to work with. They will train you if you act like you want to be there and are willing to learn. Theyll also show you how a company manages to exist and profit selling the same hamburger that theyve sold for decades.
cons: These places are busy and expectations are higher than one might generally think when taking a fast food job.

headline: Best Fast food place to work
pros: Every co worker is like family and we always got the job done
cons: If you are in high school you have to make A & B in your report card

headline: Good job to live on
pros: Great pay and easy to level up
cons: A lot of customers are rude because they hold In N Out to a higher standard. Managers and higher levels are also rude to lower levels and make you feel like crap until you don't mess up anymore. If you're ok with working fast food for the rest of your life then this is the job for you. If not, you will hate working here after a few months.

headline: LEVEL IV ASSOCIATE
pros: Great opportunity to move up levels along with pay raises. Very well structured company from stores to corporate. Teaches you great essentials to customer service and how to adapt yourself in a quickly paced environment,
cons: Not too many cons, sometimes higher levels had too much a sense of pride, they would make lower levels do difficult tasks and sometimes ignore talking to them or calling them out on the smallest mistakes.

headline: Not for everyone
pros: Pays much better than any other fast food restaurant.
cons: Very monotonous and soul-killing.

headline: Great company
pros: Fast paced work and excellent opportunities for growth.
cons: Can be stressful at times.

headline: Great Place to work
pros: Fun Atmosphere... Lots of hard workers
cons: Management changes frequently and is hardly on the same page with one another.

headline: Great Experience
pros: They take good care of you, pay is good for fast food.
cons: Customer service can be a very tough field if you have no patience.

headline: Great Company to Work For
pros: Amazing pay and benefits including Insurance, paid vacations, and 401K
cons: Extremely Busy at times and you have to keep your composure in a fast paced environment.

headline: Good company to work for while in school and even after.
pros:
Free Burger up to Double Double every shift & fries & soda!
If you work hard, and smile, you will get moved up and noticed!
Company picnic is the event of the year!! Also christmas gifts are always pretty awesome.
cons:
Hardly ever get off on your "scheduled" off time.  Usually 30 min to 1 hour longer depending on business.
Very high paced, if you like to chat and not work, this is not the job for you.

headline: management issues
pros: Pay, benefits, and family atmosphere. It was a great experience.
cons: Poor selection in managers in training. A lot of the associates training to become store managers like 4th and 3rd were I'll prepared, lacked professionalism and leadership skills. Which created a high turnover rate and unhappy employees

headline: Great people friendly environment
pros: Great atmosphere and synergistic team environment promotes teamwork and willingness to focus on customer service and excellence. Loved my managers and teammates.
cons: Challenging at times during busy times/days. Long hours on feet and reaching/stretching for ingredients during food prep. Breaks and meals cut short at times to accommodate.

headline: good pay ok people

nice company who really care about their customers
good pay
some nice employees

some rude managers
fast paced
expect to know everything

headline: level 2

Management
Customers
Not enough hours

headline: Associate

headline: Always a great atmosphere.

headline: Level 2

No degrees in management and they use constructive criticism to "grow"
Always focus on the negatives!

headline: Challenging

headline: Great part time job

headline: In n out
pros: Great company, great pay to start off. Great benefits.
cons: No cons, great company to work for

great place
room to improve

headline: Best company you can work for

cons: Long hours , only can work 2 shifts day closing, can be stressful deal with associates issue and meeting company goals

headline: Great Job for a Teenager
pros: Fun Environment, everyone is smiling and having fun while you're working. It's easy to have a positive attitude in such a positive environment! If you're in high school, college, or anything they're really good at working you on a schedule that works for you.
cons: It can take forever to get your raise or the proper training for your raise. There's definite favoritism at times, but that's apparent in any work place honestly. The hours can really suck sometimes. Some of the higher levels can be very snotty.

headline: Good company
pros:
Good job for a college
Student
cons: Dealing with poor managers and customers

headline: stressful and fast paced. you have to enjoy the work to work there. great experience and devoted managers
pros: There is a great sense of teamwork and you'll never feel alone doing a job. Managers are willing to help you out when you're overwhelmed.
cons: No breathing room in terms of standing up to a customer. Customer is always right even if their RIGHT.

headline: I enjoy the fast pace environment and the constant training that they provide for their management team.
pros: Fast pace, fun and positive work environment. The associates are hard working and always willing to help their fellow associates.
cons: Sometimes you work with unmotivated associates that bring down the positive environment and the overall shift. It is tough as a manager to work with this type of person.

headline: A great first job, helped me prepare for life.
pros: Organized, fast paced, good pay.
cons: Not your typical fast food - lot's of hard work.

headline: Good company to work for
pros: Lots of fun people to work with. great ttraining. perks like company picnics and parties when your store meets goals.
cons: It is a very fast paced environment which makes you tired very quickly but constant quality work is expected from you

headline: Level 4
pros: Company Cares about their associates
cons: part time until management, pay isn't the best

headline: A job that's fast-paced, involves teamwork and leadership, and
pros: Higher than min. wage, retirement plan, vacation benefits, free meals on work days, 15% discount at company store, friendly workers, strong community contribution.
cons: Often stressful, time-crunched, sometimes less than 4 workers, drive thru traffic problems

headline: Store associate
pros: the team aspect really helps you feel good about yourself and have fun
cons: it is really busy during the rushed

headline: Chaos
pros: good pay, advancement opportunities, free meal every shift
cons: nit picky management, strict uniform and hygiene (no more than 2 piercings on each ear and must be only on the lobe, no nail polish, tattoos, or other piercings), hard to request days off, understaffed. The rush hours are so chaotic that they make you want to have a mental breakdown and just cry. There just simply isn't enough people or space to make the amount of food for the amount of people. Customers are crazy mean and make you hate your job the way they speak to you. People expect only the best from in n out so when one little thing goes wrong, you get cussed out.

headline: Level 4 Associate
pros: The starting base salary was set at a competitive wage against other comparable establishments.  The stores are always busy, bringing in new and existing clients.
cons: You hardly ever get off at the time you were scheduled and rarely ask if there was anything else going on in your life before keeping you late into the night.

headline: My first Job. My favorite 9 to 5 type job.
pros: Great pay, raises, great food, pride in the brand.
cons: I honestly have none. Was one of my favorite experiences ever.

headline: Level 6 - Cook
pros: Great benefits and friendly people.
cons: Learn the job quick or fail trying.

headline: Store Associate
pros: Flexible hours- works with your schedule if you're going to school. You can work a different position every day. The higher the level you are, the more opportunities to work different positions. It's fast-pace so time flies by.
cons: It's a team environment so you have to rely on your coworkers to make sure the shift runs smoothly.

headline: Level 2
pros: Very flexible with school schedule, good money, free food on every shift, fun and fast paced. In N Out loves their associates.
cons: Can be very stressful at times, but that's why it's called work. Very strict policies and managers vary a lot in their intensity. Can be difficult to move up in busy stores.

headline: Rewarding
pros: High starting pay, friendly co-workers
cons: No cons at the moment

headline: Level 6 Associate
pros: Great People to work with, have built long lasting relationships with many of my co-workers. Great company culture. Fast -paced.
cons: Smell like burger and onions all the time. It is hard work, and when I was pregnant it was REALLY hard

headline: Amazing company to work for with great benefits.
pros: All of the associates are very nice and welcoming. Company as a whole treats associates very well... There's always something to do, never bored.
cons: Throughout my experience there has been nothing to complain about. They give a great amount of hours and are very flexible with schedules.

headline: The company really takes care of all its employees from top to bottom
pros: Awesome perks, great pay, flexible, and fun environment.
cons: Can be stressful at times due to the fast pace.

headline: Fast-paced and rewarding
pros: high-pay and opportunity for advancement as well as a long-term career opportunity.
cons: high-stress and always fast-paced.

headline: In-N-Out Burger has provided me with a firm understanding of discipline and social integrity.
pros: Fast-paced. Family-oriented environment. Excellent training programs. Great benefits. Friendly coworkers.
cons: Open late. Lack of academically educated managers. Minimal availability of full-time positions.

headline: great company that knows its strengths
pros:
associate mobility 
wage and benefits are industry leading
cons: sometimes getting moved up takes way more politics then it should

headline: Excellent company with a wonderful history; you're really cared about when you work for In-N-Out Burger
pros: Constantly moving up positions, good energy and communication, you're trained excellently
cons: Upper Level employees can be intimidating, but they're really kind.

headline: What a hamburger is all about.
pros: excellent pay, management, flexible scheduling,
cons: There are none that come to mind.

headline: Great company
pros: They care for the employees. Good pay
cons: They make you work for your money

headline: Earn our Money
pros: Its fun, especially once you get the hang of things. They hir great people, and if they dont those people usually end up not liking it and quitting. Store managers generally stay the same, but lower level managers they rotate a lot, so that all managers get all different kinds of experience. They rely on good training to keep things going. They pay good,  especially for a first job, but f you are looking to get into management fast, look elsewhere. They hire from within, and you work your way to the top no matter how old you are or what your experience is. Your success is dependent on how quickly you can master things, so pick up on everything that goes on, and how higher levels do things.
cons: You work HARD. If you dont want to work but need a job, go look somewhere else, because you earn your money every day. Cooks go home smelling like SH** every day because they sweat and handle raw meat, melting cheese, and grilled onions. Fry guys sweat and deal with salt and oil from fries. You are constantly moving, which can be a con to some. Also, getting into management is a game of cards. You have to play them right to get there. It  is also pretty corrupt. Expectations are not the same across the board for everybody.

headline: It's a trap
pros: The pay is good as long as you get enough hours. Flexible hours and benefits
cons: I am currently working at the busiest store in the company. And any associate and/or manager can tell you that in order for us to maintain a certain level of speed and efficiency with have to take shortcuts. But if you're seen taking these shortcuts (as everyone else does) you are threatened with a write up. You can be doing an amazing job at the task you are given and recieve no recognition or acknowledgement for your work but if you at any point fall behind regardless of whether it was in or out of your control management is standing behind you chastising you for your subpar work. Trying to voice your opinion to a manager is useless and seen as talking back when all they want to hear is a "right on".

headline: Very quick paced with customer service as a top priority.
pros: Great things include better pay than typical fast food restaurants,  perks like 401k vacation and insurance available even if you're part time. Employees are appreciated and rewarded for great work and meeting store goals. Thwy work really well with your schedule. it's very easy to get raises. Promote from within.
cons: Working pretty much every weekend. As with pretty much every place you can work, favoritism is part of everyday life.

headline: Great Company

headline: great food service job
pros: Great team environment, lots of training. Structure of management is clear and you can work your way up accordingly. Free meals when you work! And of course above average pay.
cons: The hours can vary a lot  and it depends on your managers how accommodating they are of your schedule. It sucks to close when there's a concert or event nearby, or having to work on a holiday. INO is only closed Christmas, Thanksgiving, and Easter so every other day is considered a normal working day, no overtime.

headline: Everything You Hear is True

headline: Wonderful place to work and a great company to grow with.

opportunity for job advancement

headline: Everyone is very friendly. A very team-oriented business. Fast pasted and lots of chances for raises.

headline: It was OK
pros: Pay is great and so are hours if you want them.
cons: Work/Life balance is out of wack. Expected to be available at all times. Can be seriously understaffed at times. Expected to be able to handle multiple jobs at once.

headline: Great Company, Great Mission Statement and Values, Takes care of the Customer AND the Employee
pros:
Most managers can be flexible and are understanding of schedules. This was a great job to have while going to school. My fiancé is a manager and it's also a great full time job and career to pursue. There is definitely good money involved. You work hard, it's fast paced, there's training constantly, great employee benefits, pay in general is pretty good, it can be a fun environment, vacation hours are good, the mini parties and activities that the company offers are great. 
Overall, a great company to work for and the policies they have are in a place. It is really a lifestyle choice to work there because the policies are so strict.
cons:
You work your butt off and sometimes the association that your around (the younger kids) don't really understand everything. It is extremely hard on the body. 
Although the pay is good, if you are working there long term and say you don't want to go into management, your pretty much at a freeze in pay with no where to go. Example, I've been there 5 years, but if someone who's been there 2 years gets to the same level as me, they'll be making the exact same. It's like a union. 
There can be a lot of policies to follow, which I find to actually be a pro for the most part. 
Some managers are very power hungry and they know that some employees depend on their income and they take advantage of that. The frustrating part is when they are very "clever" about it and they get the company to support them in their motives. 
Customers at time can rule your life. You can do everything right, but a customer that has one bad view can kill a career. Love the customers, they're why In-N-Out thrives, but some of them are very... not understanding.

headline: Excellent company to work for but there are some drawbacks
pros:
The pay is great for a fast food restaurant.
The people who work for In-N-Out are awesome, I love my coworkers.
The training is done well and you're able to move up quickly if you work hard.
cons:
Often they will under staff and the workload can be super stressful. 
If you work there full time, you'll often work over 40 hours and have shifts that are late at night.

headline: This is the perfect first job!
pros: The company culture is extremely positive and goal oriented. INO constantly helps their employees grow into hard working individuals in any market.
cons: This is a lot of physical labor. The stress and physical fatigue can definitely get to you. Also, it is extremely tempting to eat the food daily which can be unhealthy over time.

headline: Working at In N Out is like getting out of bed, hopping on your bicycle, and riding to your 2nd home. An absolute joy.

cons: Very VERY competitive if you plan on making a career out it. (Which isn't all that bad of a career, honestly. You could be at a six figure salary within 5-10 years if you're dedicated.)

headline: Good Times
pros: Great atmosphere, hard satisfying work, great people. There was a lot of room for growth and the pay and benefit opportunities were awesome.

headline: Great First Job or College Job
pros: In-N-Out truly values their associates. Training is thorough and guidelines are very clear. Associates are trained to be efficient and productive multitaskers with a strong focus on team and morale. The company puts on several events for associates a year, 2 days of holiday pay, some medical benefits, profit sharing, and even vacation pay to its part-time associates. I have always felt that I had the tools I needed to succeed, and the pay is great compared to any other fast food joint.
cons: The fast-pace and often high-volume nature of working at In-N-Out can be very stressful. There will always be more pressure to go faster and do more without sacrificing quality. Managers are transferred from store to store fairly frequently which can make working under a manager who isn't used to the store's business patters or team dynamic very challenging.

headline: Great first job--teaches life skills. 8.5 years with company.
pros: Upbeat atmosphere where time flies and you feel like you are hanging with friends. You learn to work very efficiently--hard work is a requirement,  as well as attention to detail.  Laziness is not tolerated. You also learn to take criticism well, because constant feedback is given.  Customer service is so important--many shy people burst out of their bubble in the job. The environment created is one of pride in what you do,  which builds a family feeling at work.
cons: The hours are rough; working until 2:30 in the morning,  then coming back for a day shift the next day is commonplace.  And the work is physically laborious and fast paced, which can be stressful. The job really takes a toll on your body.

headline: Wow?
pros: Great leadership and great salaries and benefits. I loved working here while I was in college. I would recommend this company to all young men and women
cons: I really can't think of any.

headline: I LOVE THIS JOB
pros:
There are many things that I love about In-N-Out. One is that they train you very well. You watch about five hours of videos before you're even allowed to step foot onto the red tiles. You're not thrown into a situation unless the managers feel you are ready, and in general (at least in my store) everyone is usually genuinely nice and willing to help you out. I've been with the company a little over a year, and I have been promoted to a level 4. You get promoted by working hard, and although it wasn't always easy, you have your managers as a support team to help you level up. My store manager is very thoughtful in making sure every single employee gets the schedule they want (which is tough considering we all have different school schedules) but he gets it done either way. The coworkers are awesome! We all are on some level of friendship, and it's definitely a great place to work! In the area I live, the starting wage was at $11, and I am now making $12.50 per hour.  
Oh yeah I also love how high the In-N-Out standards are! If the burger doesn't look like the picture, we send it back ourselves. We always have the customers' best interest in mind. The food is fresh, our health standards are the highest among other fast food restaurant, and I love how customer oriented our company is. It shows that we actually care about the food we are serving.
This was also my first job, and I am very lucky I got hired here.
cons: Like what I mentioned before, there are some rough days. Sometimes, the rush hour is too much, and being on fries by yourself is stressful. There are a lot of aspects about the job that are stressful, but the only reason we stress so much is because we want to make the best burger possible. Even though I've been there over a year I still stress about how perfect my fries turn out, how nicely I wrap my burgers, and sometimes even how clean the floor looks. And during rush hours it gets really hectic. Everyone gets stressed about trying to hurry yet keep the same quality, but as soon as the rush is over we kind of take a look around, sigh, and laugh about it. Work isn't easy, but the coworkers make it a lot more fun. And yes it's true, you will smell like burgers for the rest of the day. Oh, and since we are a customer based company, sometimes you get the customer who isn't in a good mood, and that might really ruin your day, but you just have to remember that it's one unhappy customer, among the hundreds who have come through and appreciate your hard work.

headline: Positive & FreeSpirited
pros: The best reason to work at In n Out is because of all the positive people, the smiles, the upbeat attitudes. It's a good atmosphere to be in. VERY great at making sure before you go up on your levels that you have enough experience and confidence that when asked to do something you know how to do it. It's very fast paced, so it helps you learn how to work well under pressure, but also being able to smile & give the customers the best experience. Reasonable AND flexible work hours. They are really good about making sure you do have a social life but that you also work. Especially if you are in college or have another job. The pay is great.
cons: Not always getting off on your scheduled time..

headline: Experience
pros: It's a fun, fast-paced environment. As a 19-year-old its freaking fun! Everyone loves In N Out and I just loved servicing the people! Great experience if you keep a positive attitude. It's a fast-food restaurant, therefore you have to deal with awesome and not so awesome customers.
cons: Since there is levels, higher levels treat lower levels like they were high school freshmen. It's immature.

headline: I loved working for this company.
pros: Great atmosphere. Management is capable, understanding, and flexible. Potential for quick growth through company. Training is thorough and efficient. Treat their employees with good benefits, paid vacation, awards, gifts, and parties.
cons: Results vary with each store. I had a wonderful experience working for my store, however I never transferred or worked anywhere else. So there is potential for some bad crews out there, however I do not know this for a fact. There is also some late night work.

headline: Great company to work for, but be willing to WORK for it.
pros: Variety of customers can be fun. We get lots of tourists, even occasional celebrities. Free burgers. Get to learn the "secret menu".  The pay is great considering it's fast food. INO prides itself in always giving more than minimum wage. Awesome first job (if you're up for it). Family owned (not a chain) so it still has strong core values. Believes in community service/ charity. Everyone gets Easter, Thanksgiving and Xmas off. There's also benefits available and room for advancement. Training is better than other places I've worked, they really push you to move up levels (at least at my store). Most coworkers are friendly, supportive and motivated.  Scheduleing can be flexible if you're a student/ religious/ have another job. Offers company picnics/ events and awards (theme parks, gift cards, sport tournaments). Fast-paced environment (can be a pro or con). It's the most demanding job I've had but my favorite so far.
cons: Expect to work long hours/ late (clocking out at 2am on a closing shift). Strict dress code and policies (pro when it comes to quality). Some people say you gain weight from eating burgers haha but INO does offer discounted gym memberships. I'm part-time so I usually work 6hr shifts. Full time can work 8+hr shifts. So if your schedule says 11-3 they can keep you longer. I learned to live with it (more hrs = more money) but it seems to bug a lot of people. I've noticed management/ advancing can get political and cause drama. Also, seems to be more men than women in management, but that's just an observation. The customers can be very specific and rude or have no idea what to order and then blame you for not getting what they wanted. But you have to learn how to deal with people at any job. It makes the nice customers that much better to serve.

headline: Associate
pros: Very fun place to work.  Almost all coworkers are super friendly and outgoing.  Management was great and fair with scheduling
cons: Takes a while to move up levels and pay is too low on the lower levels.  Wish there was a faster process of moving up for the hard working individuals

headline: Amazing place to work
pros: They only promote from within, excellent pay, flexible schedule, fun environment, great training, awesome co-workers, free burger during every shift. Expect their employees to work hard.
cons: There really weren't any cons for me when I worked at In N Out Burger. It's definitely tough work and you have to consistently have a great attitude so it was annoying when coworkers couldn't hang but I highly recommend working here!

pros: Great pay. Raises often get lots of hours.management willing to work with schedules. Amazing company outings and opportunities to make more money and move up. Lots of locations make commuting not so bad
cons: Pay is great but it is hard work making the burgers d fries. Heavy lifting. Dangers with fry diced and onion slicer. And working the grill can be very exhausting. Long hours. Also very strict on appearance hair colors fake nails nail polish men facial hair.

headline: Great high school job. Good college job. Not-so-great of a career.
pros: Hours & pay is pretty decent for college. Very flexible schedule. They'll be good to you if you're good to them.
cons: Though duty placement may seem merit based to some, it can be seen as favoritism to others.

headline: Good pay and good food
pros: They pay well and scheduling is flexible.  Non-confrontational (could be a con, too) - if a customer wants it, they get it.
cons: If you're not cleaning or making something, you are not working.  I got in trouble many times for socializing with customers during slow time with nothing to do.

headline: best burger joint to work for
pros: great pay, room for advancement, great benefits, great values. free meal everyday you work. flexible schedule which is great if your in school or have another job.
cons: labor intense. it can be challenging to work fries or the grill. you are constantly moving around. you always have to stay busy. it gets really busy and you have to overcome stress.

headline: Level 6 Associate
pros: The company treats their employees well. The pay is good, definitely higher than other fast food places. There is usually a good amount of flexibility. Good culture!
cons:
Work is tough, if you want to do really well, expect to work VERY hard. Depending on your region, manager turn over can be high. Managers often get moved around to different stores. That can be challenging for store morale. When a new manager comes in, they bring in their own unique style - can be an adjustment. 

The company is very proud of their Californian heritage, which they should be! However, when people from California move out to different regions they sometimes become negative. You'll hear a lot about how "it's better in California", or "everyone works harder back home". It very well may be true, but it comes across as distasteful to local hires. If California was so awesome, why did you leave? I am not referring to the majority of employees, just a few.

headline: Awesome place for first job!
