headline: Customer Service, Cook, and Clean
pros: Great Wage for the industry; work with great people; good training and team development; fast pace, shifts go by fast; the company offers lots of benefits to their employees
cons: Sometimes working with young immature kids, the occasional nasty customer, you smell when your shift is over, you don't have a consistent schedule and working late nights and weekends

headline: You won't regret this job...if you can smile and work hard.
pros: Great pay. The company treats you better than any company can.
cons: It's growing fast and losing some of the family feel.

headline: Amazing Job to work For
pros: Good paid, free food and great benefits
cons: really fast paced and work around the clock

headline: Working at In-N-Out is a life-consuming, fast-paced, conservative place to work at.
pros: Super easy to get promoted, reasonable pay, free burger (up to a double-double), fries and soda whenever you work, store parties (hockey games, Dave & Busters, go karting, Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, etc.) whenever your store reaches its goals, generally all your coworkers are having a good vibes when you work, good hours, annual picnic.
cons: Very conservative: No tattoos, piercings, or any hairstyles. TRANSFERS. The biggest con that I still don't really understand is transferring, I had been on medical leave for 4 months and during those 4 months, I moved from San Jose, CA to Tracy, CA. The transfer system goes like this for INO; you let your manager know you need a transfer, you talk to the store manager of the new store you would like to/need to transfer to and they confirm with you a date for an interview, you go to the interview at the new store, and depending on how you did and what kind of review you get from your previous manager, you get hired or you're SOL, meaning apply to another INO near you or resign from the company. What doesn't make sense to me is why I would have to go through an interview process if I was already employed with the company, I was trying to return for medical leave to help support my family, but the new store manager already seemed to have a prejudice against me before the interview and the hard work of two years i had put in with the company already was lost too.

headline: Level 7
pros: Great workers fast paced really fun job
cons: Always on your feet sometimes rude customers

headline: overall a good experience
pros: Good pay for type of work done.  They are very cooperative about school schedules.  Good benefits.
cons: Management in some stores can tend to play favorites as to who gets promoted.

headline: Best fast food burgers!!!
pros: Fair workload and pay, and a daily meal. ;-)
cons: It's fast food, so it's not a career for most people unless you go into management.

headline: Amazing experience
pros: You get a great pay, free meals every time you work, great environment, and you feel like you are part of a family.
cons: You don't work according to your schedule. You'll work for at least 6 hours a shift.

headline: Great Company
pros: Great people, good starting pay, ability to move up, training, company activities.
cons: Managers show favoritism, people who show interest in management move up faster than those who have been there longer. Depending on location the culture is a bit different.

headline: In n out is the best part time job you can get!
pros:
Fastpaced
Good pay
Possitive work environment
Company perks such as party's and rewards for good work
Super fun!
cons: Not many cons! Just be prepared to work your butt off because they expect it!

headline: Great company to work for
pros: Great pay and company takes care of their employees
cons: Physical work. Always working hard.

headline: Best company to work for
pros: Great atmosphere full of hard working and fun individuals. Opportunity for advancement. Excellent pay.
cons: You may not get to work a lot of hours depending on the local and the level you are working.

headline: Awesome Company!
pros: If you work hard and can keep up promotions and raises are simple. You are always working on how well you work and what you can get better at. Company picnic with free food, fair rides, water park, and concert is included every year. You get very used to the people you work with, they become close friends. All employees get a gift for meeting burger quotas and safety. Over the course of my employment I got an mp3 player, a Bluetooth, glass chess set etc.
cons: It's very frustrating because everyone you work with depends on each other. Therefore, if one person isn't doing their job, everyone else has to work harder. Like all jobs there are favoritism issues with managers. You have to be available always. Work-life can either be great or horrible. Associates are very competitive in this company, if you can't keep up, if you don't speak up about issues, and if you are very emotional, you may have a hard time.

headline: Excellent first job!
pros: I love working at in n out. The managers treat us like a family and they really do care. The staff is really friendly and they always help each other out. You get raises really quickly, depending on how fast you learn.
cons: Just the customers. Some of them are complicated. Other than that, nothing to complain about really.

headline: Very political but a good college job
pros:
- Great pay for students
- Flexible Hours
- Company picnics and sporting events
- For the most part hires very pleasant and enjoyable people
cons:
- Upper management (DM's and even store managers) are out of the loop on both good and bad performance issues
- Very political once you reach level 7 on up ...promotions were about 90% politics and 10% actual performance
- Not exactly an intellectually stimulating environment...hard to work for some managers when you feel you can't learn anything from them (see previous point)
- Felt that many changes in company procedures were the result of a DM or RM trying to put their name on something, rather than the new procedure actually being beneficial

headline: Overall pretty good, but kind of stressful because of the management.
pros: The pay is great in comparison to other fast food gigs. Free meals everyday of work (my favorite part), the hours are flexible i you know your schedule ahead of time. Training to move up was pretty good, and with just hard work you can move up.
cons: managers were sometimes hard to deal with, and obviously set the schedule for their selves. The were mostly on he grill, thus when you were knew you had to rely on other new guys.

headline: Perfect of students
pros: You get to meet a lot of people, the pay is the highest in the industry, can be fun.
cons: Not enough hours for part timers. You have to work the weekends

headline: Great environment, not enough pay
pros: Everyone you work with is amazing, they literally become your family. Nobody is left without support, always room to grow and at a fast rate too. Its up to you to make it happen if you really want it though.
cons: The work sometimes is way too hard and demanding. Even though it pays better than other restaurants, I feel that sometimes it isn't enough.

headline: Great company
pros: Great place to work. Strong team environment and everyone is like family. Company also gives perks such as company picnics, Christmas presents, paid vacations, store parties etc. Great benefits for full time associates
cons: Alot of high expectations can lead to stressful situations. Also sometimes there is favortism in the workplace and politics

headline: Great company, good pay, flexible schedule. Some poor management, very strict.
pros:
Great pay.
Flexible scheduling (work with school/personal).
Free meal per shift.
Annual picnics.
Rewards and holiday gifts (In-n-Out chess sets, sleeping bags, sweaters, shirts, etc).
cons:
Very strict about appearance (must be clean shaven every shift, no hair touching the top of your ears or back of your collar).
You won't be prioritized to be promoted if you aren't buddies with management.
High stress.
VERY picky customers.
Usually a lot of high school kids in each store, creates a sort-of immature environment.

headline: good people, good food, stressful environment
pros: work with a lot of great people, fast paced, family atmosphere, everyone starts from the bottom, pay is very good given the industry.  several company functions throughout the year.
cons: as a manager, a lot of performance goals are unrealistic.  if you serve the customer they way they want you to, you're going to miss a lot of your goals.   job can be pretty stressful.  politics game is played quite a bit.  work/life balance is nonexistent, you find the majority of your friends are people you work with.  only one weekend off per month (until you become manager of your own store, then you get a max of two per month).  rotating schedule is either 8-6pm or 430p to 2a (which is sometimes followed by a 10a-630p), and day and night shifts happen all in the same work week.   if you have a child, work/life balance is harder to balance.

headline: Such a great first job!
pros: Flexible hours, awesome managers and coworkers, leadership really help you to keep going, they understand your circumstances
cons: Not super fast in moving up the ladder but it's great for a first job experience.

headline: Friendly, High Paying
pros: Free meals, good company to work for, good pay
cons: heard there is a minimum GPA requirement to work there now? Not sure.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Co-workers are awesome and good starting pay.
cons: You may be hurting after your shifts, physically and emotionally.

headline: Fun and some nice perks but low quality of life
pros: It's a fast paced environment, especially in high volume stores and time goes by quickly. They offer fun activities and perks like company picnics and events.
cons: "Work/life balance" is a foreign concept. You're expected to be available for work at a moments notice and to put it before everything else, including family or other obligations.

headline: FAST PACED
pros: The relationships you build with the customers are amazing. Sometimes the customers end up being "usuals" and then friends.
cons: You gotta put up with other loud mouthed coworkers. Overtime and closing sucks, because there is always a line to the street. You will go home exhausted at 3 a.m or 4 a.m and maybe expected to work the next morning.

headline: Excellent Employer!
pros: Family-like atmosphere. Teaches communication, teamwork, and good work ethic. Fabulous benefits for full time employees and competitive salary for all employees.
cons: You need to be available with a flexible schedule. Some holidays are given off, but not all. Weekends are often required.

headline: Great Part Time Job
pros: Good Pay, great learning experience, teaches good work ethic.
cons: Can be stressful at times

headline: Amazing Company
pros: In-N-Out was my very first job at 17 and it was a great experience. I started at 10 an hour and management advanced me quickly. The actual store manager was great and funny. Worked well with my school schedule. Free meal every shift. We got christmas presents every year from corporate and gift cards for doing a good job. Received a lot of recognition. The company genuinely cares for your well being. There were basketball and softball tournaments which were soooo fun. Left making 11.50 an hour.
cons: A lot of coworkers liked to stir up drama, I have seen a lot of crying there because of it. A lot of secrets and back stabbing. 2nd,3rd,4th managers are a joke and pick favorites and would get mad if you didn't want to cover someone else's shift. Younger managers power trip when older mangers weren't around. Very stressful and always had to be on top of it (which isn't a con, just a fact). Fairly high turnover rate, at least for my store.

headline: Great...treat their associates like family and very flexible.
pros: Flexible hours, benefits, and paid holidays
cons: Not getting enough hours.

headline: In-N-Out was a great place to work.
pros: At In-N-Out your coworkers are fun and enjoyable people to be around and the team is usually led by a competent manager. The training for each position is extensive and allows for proper promotions and pay increases. The pay is very good for the work being performed.
cons: Some managers are not as good at running shifts as others and can make working difficult. Dealing with customer service can be frustrating at times.

headline: great people, hard work
pros: industry leading pay, work with a lot of great people, culture
cons: performance goals often conflict with company expectations for cleanliness and service standards.  the politics game played often.  stress levels can often be high.

headline: Upbeat and friendly but pretty strict
pros: Management wants to see you increase in levels (get raises)
cons:
Depending on manager, they can freak out about the little things (nail polish, fly away hairs, etc)

Very hard to get full time

headline: Amazing, many opportunities and it looks great on a resume.
pros: If you're a business management major, this is the place to get experience for leadership.
cons: There are no cons for this company. You just have to prove you want to be their and grow with the company.

headline: I miss working here!
pros: free burger and fries with a drink when working. great pay. friendly staff. good management(from what i remember) and great benefits
cons: ugly uniforms, high stress levels, annoying customers, smelling like onions, long hours on your feet.

headline: Neutral
pros: As a starter and as my first job, I get great pay, free meals on break, and get to meet great people.
cons: Managers are a little passive when I casually report a conflict with another associate (example: another associate will rudely boss me around as well as rudely be sarcastic with me when it is only a managers place to explain what I should be cleaning up and so forth. The manager lets it happen). Some co-workers are not very accepting and rude; they always try to get me in trouble/written up. Applied for a part-time job asking for at least 18 hours a week - scheduled for one day a week, sometimes only for three hours.

headline: Exciting Experience
pros:
Welcomed customers and assisted patrons as necessary
Processed food orders and offered information regarding menus
Operated cash register 
Cleaned and disinfected work station, utensils and customer dining area
Helped with various kitchen-related functions as required
cons: Too crowded. However, overall I had a phenomenal experience enhancing my customer service skills.

headline: It pays well but it isn't easy
pros: The pay above minimum, some co-workers
cons: Not a lot of training, co-workers and managers can be extremely rude, customers constantly treat workers with disrespect and you actually have to put up with it with a smile on your face, being told to constantly smile and talk with a high pitched influx in your voice

headline: Very great place to work
pros: Some of the best things about working here is you learn a whole lot more then just customer service, you get connected with everybody else.
cons: Nothing bad about they company in my eyes

headline: Ok for a starter job
pros: The atmosphere is laid back compared to other jobs. Easy to get time off if you need a flexible schedule.
cons: Management is so young, and so flaky. Lots of playing favorites, lots of partying with associates.

headline: Awesome
pros: In n out burger allowed me to grow professionally and personally with flexible hours and proper training. Great team environment and mostly good management that enforced the commitment of high quality service.
cons: This is definitely a team work heavy job and often times if you get a fellow associate or even manager mad, they will push more of the work on you.

headline: Perfect first job
pros: Very flexible hours, great benefits and pay. Awesome coworkers and company culture. Best job to have during college. Looks great on resume.
cons: A bit stressful. The job is very physically intensive. There is a larger focus on inventory and following many policies.

headline: Energetic Environment
pros:
Good pay for younger people
Energetic place
Flexible schedule
Nice associates
cons:
Keep you longer than scheduled often
Not good for long term career

headline: Great
pros: Great company to work for compared to other fast food companies. Pay is above average, culture and atmosphere are fun. You move up in rank easily (which comes with a pay increase), are rewarded with parties when your store meets goals.
cons: Hard to become a full time worker, due to them being required to offer health benefits after a certain amount of hours. As part time you do get dental and vision though.

headline: Fantastic
pros: pay, hours, people that you work with, many i am still friends with today, two years later
cons: hard work. While In n out pays nicely you work hard for it. I can also get repetitive after a while.

headline: In-N-Out has a very fast service and is very good
pros: They have flexibile hours.  The pay is also not too bad considering it is not a particularity hard job to do.  It is a great part time job
cons: You smell like food and sweat after.  You get to eat the food there, but it is also bad because you end up gaining weight from all the free burgers and shakes.

headline: Amazing!
pros: Great pay rates, fantastic hours, calm and comfortable atmosphere, plenty of benefits, full of oppurtunity friendly coworkers, overall very happy with the experience I gain here.
cons: Dress code is VERY strict. Perfection is expected and mediocrity is not tolerated. Fast-paced, which can get very difficult, especially in my store, which is just off the freeway.

headline: High stress with OK pay
pros:
Who doesn't love In N Out? 
It's a great place to work at if you're a high school student or even a college student. The company itself is great and they appreciate their associates. You can even get dental/eye insurance as a part-time associate for a small fee.
cons:
Very high stress and it's not recommended for those with a nervous/anxious persona. You will not stop moving and the customers are allowed to treat however they want.
They're not always flexible when it comes to scheduling and some managers may be too overbearing.

headline: Great place to work.
pros: Great people, fun fast placed job, with room to make really good money in management.
cons: Good luck moving up unless your loved by the upper management in your division. Will expect you to live by there rules and run to work if needed only for an hour or two.

headline: Great start pay!
pros: Friendly coworkers, great pay, great place for a part-time gig
cons: Sometimes gotta clean the bathroom

headline: dependable
pros: has great pay, flexible hours
cons: can be very physically straining.

headline: Level 4
pros: Some of the pros include higher than average pay for the industry, though they will work you for it. Corporate had regular benefits such as a day where your store could sign up to go to a water park for free. Free burger for everyday you worked, two if you worked 8+ hours, and free soda, though this is monumentally unhealthy, and it definitely showed, as many of my coworkers gained a good bit of weight, and could barely run as shown during our employee set up football game on thanksgiving. Also vacation time, even for part time employees, was a plus.
cons:
For starters management was terrible, over my time had a number of different managers, though a few remained constant. Each had different things that made them bad, one was terribly incompetent, another rude and passive aggressive, but the main first manager was loud, rude, would yell at employees in front of customers, and was just downright mean, but whenever the district manager (could fill another paragraph on him; long story short he operated on intimidation) would come around and she would turn into the nicest person ever. Favoritism was rampant and blatant, as well as many instances of sexism, and being a male I was actually on the benefiting side of this, this was against the female employees from the female managers.
But overall, my biggest complaint is that I worked there from age 17 to 18, and was still in high school and then college, and I was working SIX day weeks and 40 hours (except when the week came that they would have had to legally make me full time came around) nearly the entire time I worked there, which as a 17 year old in high school on a work permit is very illegal, however when I was 18 it was technically fair game, not that it mattered. I asked to move to a reasonable five days a week and was completely disregarded and worked six day a week till I quit. There were multiple occasions in which I was getting off at 2 AM just to go to school at 7 and then return for the night shift again. Though in fairness, things have apparently changed since my leaving and they have begun upholding the part-time/full-time labor laws.

headline: Fast paced
pros: Good people, a lot of communication
cons: Stressful at times, fast paced work

headline: dead end stepping stone.
pros: great job for a first job other than that no place to stay long term
cons: dead end if you are looking for a career

headline: It's a good fast pace environment time goes by fast but don't get to comfortable working there ,
pros: The company has great pay and time goes by fast
cons: Management sucks they don't know how to run shifts  , managers just stay in the office all day and expect the levels 7's to do all there work . Most of the workers are fake with you it's all an act that they put on.

headline: Amazing food and service
pros: Great food, staff is always friendly, place is always clean
cons: Line is always incredibly long because of very few locations

headline: In-N-Out is a top of the line company that treats their employees well, and pays great!
pros: Starting pay for me was $10.00.  They are eager to give you raises, and help you progress and learn new skills.  You learn how to work hard, and not waste time.
cons: the shifts are shorter than normal for the firs year or so, until they find you are interested, and you get a few raises.

headline: Level 4
pros:
Awesome pay for fast food industry
Very flexible hours (ideal for college student)
Most associates work hard and care about the team, which makes working fun and rewarding
Most managers I had were really good and were fun being around
Lots of company events such as basketball, softball tournaments, annual picnic, etc
Free custom INO Christmas gift annually
INO has a very good reputation to the public, proud to say you work there
cons: Like all places in the fast food industry, hours can be cut short due to lack of customers, or you may feel obligated to stay many hours after your shift ends to help out your team when it's packed.

headline: Good paychecks but a very stressful job
pros: Good pay, relatively flexible hours, good customer service skills can be acquired on the job, usually good employees and realistic/understanding managers.
cons: late nights, hungry customers are rude, you can only fake happiness in front of customers for so long before it wears you out

headline: Hard work for above average pay
pros: It's good money, and my store felt like a second family
cons: They work you to the bone

headline: Favoritism Over Hard Work
pros: Some of the employees are lovely people to work with, other employers are happy to hear you worked for In N Out, You get a free meal with each shift (not including shakes, more than two meat patties, or two slices of cheese), everyone is wearing the same outfit, and it's completely unflattering so you don't have to worry about girls/guys judging your body (they can't see it) I liked the forced modesty. Customers were typically friendly and happy to be there, they hold In N Out employees in high esteems. I made some nice friends who are all very different. The diversity is awesome. I respect the Christian faith the C.E.O. Lynsi Torres brings into the privately owned company. The upper management are wonderful people, genuinely wanting to help better the service being provided. There are many different events the company puts on for the employees as well, creating unity. I admire the generosity. One Day I will own a successful business. Working at In N Out has enlightened me on how to improve a grand business.
cons: To be blunt, the store managemt did not treat majority of the employees well, and let their favoritism over look many things that were considered "unacceptable" to the company. I would like to believe other In N Out stores are far less reliant on favoritism, and valued the hard work, and good character of their employees, but I most certainly cannot say that about the store I worked at. The managers appeared to be reading from a script that mad them politically correct, but when the script was done and they added a few of their own words, it was plain to see the In N Out values were not theirs. When I was hired I was told if I worked hard, asked for help, advice, and was providing excellent service, I could "move up the totem pole." This most definitely was not the case. There was a lot of drama. I suppose it is fast food, but I expected more from In N Out.  I noticed the spirit of joy in providing great service fell in many of the people around me as they realized they would have to suck up to the managers and spend time with their favorite group of people outside of work to get promoted. While it would seem a nice idea to have a sense of community, all they really did was talk about each other behind their backs. One manager in particular took a great dislike to me. No one knew why, but yes, everyone appeared to notice,  and ask me why I let her treat me the way she did. I came to work to provide excellent service for a paycheck, not to have childish bickering with a childish manager. I have a lack of respect in the idea that someone who behaves so poorly can become a manager and be expected to reap amazing results. That just sounds like and equation for disaster. A manager that is not good with high stress situations should not be a manager, sadly, those are the kinds of managers at this store. The main store manager was very uninvolved in the unity of the store, I wonder if he knew that was on his script. Oddly enough, these are only the very surface details of the problems at store 247. I feel liberated. Now that I don't work there. My hard work is actually appreciated now. When I own my own business, I will surely be on the lookout for mishaps like these that can strain the success of my company, and my employers well being.

headline: In-n-out burger is filled with great job opportunity and a ton of great people to work with.
pros: A great environment, great managers, free meal every day that you work, and lots of opportunity to prove yourself
cons: Scheduled hours are not guaranteed. For example you could be scheduled for a 5 hour shift and be sent home after 2 hours depending on business.

headline: Employment was as satisfying as their burgers.
pros:
-Flexible with school hours
-Great sense of community (store and region)
ex: softball tournaments, annual picnic party
-Supervisors care about employees
-Store meetings were FUN 
ex: Burger TV
-Free burgers and fries each shift
-extraordinary training program
cons: -Lunch meals include only burger, regular fries and a drink. Sometimes I wanted a milkshake or animal fries.

headline: Great Job!
pros: Great people, great pay, awesome food, truly focused on the customer.
cons: Sometimes hard hours (closing and then opening the next day)

headline: Good Experience But Be Prepared to Work Hard!!!
pros:
-Pay is above minimum wage
-Good opportunity for advancement within the company
-Keep getting pay raises
-Teaches you communication and team work
-They work around school schedule
cons: -You work a lot so wont have much time off

headline: LOVE IT (STORE 252) METRO az
pros:
flexible schedule 
EXCELLENT training
VERY organized 
GREAT PAY$ 
SUPER friendly coworkers
get holidays off & PAID ( thanksgiving,easter, christmas)
cons: Customers take advantage of how nice we are.

headline: fantastic
pros: very good food at a great value and fairly quick
cons: it can get packed and full

headline: Good Experience at In-n-out
pros: In n out provided me with a good salary for someone with no experience in the restaurant industry. It was a very fast paced environment which helped me with my customer service skills. I also learned how to multi task here.
cons: The work environment is extremely stressful and hectic. You are constantly on your feet and sometimes it can be overwhelming and get the best of you.

headline: Shift Manager
pros: Consistent emphasis on training and development and integrity of product quality, exceptional service, and cleanliness of environment.  Amazing company culture and history, and ample opportunities for growth and success for its people.
cons: Under poor leadership, the individual store performance struggles and can be detrimental to store's well being in the long term.

headline: Great company to work for, friendly environment
pros:
Free burgers for lunch
Store picnic and parties
good pay for a fast food restaurant
opportunities are always available to move up
cons: At some stores there is very little job rotation. You will tend to be stuck in the same position all day, or even all year.

headline: Good For A While...Then Goes Downhill
pros: Fast-paced, good exercise (depending on what you're doing that day), good food, free meals, better than minimum-wage jobs.
cons: Poor management, increasingly strenuous working conditions, highly repetitive tasks, store closes late (which means working til 2am or later on closing shifts), strict grooming requirements (short hair required, no facial hair or stubble), must deal with the (more than) occasional rude/obscene customer, and employees are not valued above the bottom-line (always driven hard to reach sales goals that give monetary bonuses to management, but nothing to employees).

headline: Fantastic starter job for me
pros: Fast paced job with little downtime to keep your head off the clock. Future employers were excited about my customer service experience learned at In N Out. Other employees are a pleasure to work with and everyone smiles! Josh James is a great guy and a better manager
cons: Exhausted after a long day!

headline: I am blessed!!
pros: Working at In-N-Out Burger is a blessing. There is a strong team-oriented atmosphere with your fellow associates and after a while everyone becomes family. In-N-Out values the customer and does not take them for granted. In-N-Out's main priority isn't about money like many other fast-food restaurants, In-N-Out makes sure that it is all about the customer receiving quality food and services in a spotless sparkling environment. As an associate of any level, you are empowered to make sure the customers are taken care of, and you don't have to get the manager for everything. If you are capable of taking care of the customers need (i.e. replacing a wrong order) you have the empowerment to do that yourself. Training is great, everyone has a positive attitude and minimum wage is $10.50!! It is a great job with very flexible hours, great for students or people working 2 jobs.
cons: I honestly have nothing negative to say about this company. I would recommend anyone to apply to work here, it is like nowhere you have or will work at again.

headline: Best job ever!
pros: I Love my job! The people I work with are great! And my managers really pushed me to get to my level two.
cons: I can't think of any cons of working here.

headline: I hate the way they treat employees
pros: Pros: Good pay, you can have a burger on your break, you get pretty flexible hours, and it can be a fun environment to work at.
cons: Cons: Managers don't care about employees only on whether we sell or not, the managers can be rude, some customers can be incredibly rude (got fries thrown at me because they were cold.), they don't train employees well, and treat you like slaves.

headline: Great place to work at for a Student
pros:
Working at at this company taught me how to work hard.
Good pay for working in the fast food industry
cons:
Having to work in a High stress environment
Working late a night
serving large numbers of people
doing the same job over and over again

headline: A great place to work!
pros: Great company to work for as a high school student, good wages and good people.
cons: You are kept very busy all the time. But you get paid well for it.

headline: PEEL THOSE POTATOES TIL YOU GET TO THE TOP
pros:
Climbing the ladder only takes the basics (hard work, follow the rules, consistency)
DAILY free meal (This could be a CON too I guess lol)
Pay rate is higher than any other fast food restaurant
cons:
strict scheduling
manager/supervisor is usually on the grill...LITERALLY cooking...so there seems to be an obvious "blind spot" to other areas of the restaurant

headline: Level 6
pros: great people, up beat attitude, free food
cons: hours of operations.  open everyday.. close late

headline: Fantastic First Job
pros:
Competitive Salary
Friendly Work Environment
Teaches you how to work hard for the things that you want
Great First Job
cons: Not too many cons, really I cant think of any cons other than the burger joint stigma associated with it

headline: Dont apply
pros: It pays more than other fast food jobs, and a flexible schedule.
cons: Management doesnt know how to run a shift, they play favorites, you can never get full time hours and benefits once youre hired. lucky at some store if you get more then 25 hrs a week. They treat you like garbage for certain positions and they protect their managers more than their associates.

headline: level 5 associate
pros: Great pay, great co-workers, flexible hours, and good benefits
cons: Many rules and always busy!

headline: in n out
pros: good pay for fast food
cons: hard work for fast food

headline: Part-time manager
pros: Willing to work around schedule. Treat you amazing
cons: Closing 5p.m.-2a.m. keeps you out late and you work like 2 people

headline: GREAT COLLEGE JOB
pros: worked with cute girls, saw my friends come in a lot, can call in sick whenever you want, easy to be promoted
cons: smell like greasy burgers every day, get tired of the constant rush at in n out. sometimes not enough employees to staff a busy night

headline: Good place to work while in school
pros: Great pay for the job
cons: either long or short shifts

headline: Good first job
pros: This is a good paying job for the background required, the food was always a nice perk, good atmosphere to work in, good opportunities for advancement if you work hard
cons: You will ALWAYS smell like burgers, shifts are right in the middle of the day, some of the management I encountered was not professional

headline: Great Company!
pros: Fun place to work at!
cons: You end up moving a lot since it is a high paced restaurant.

headline: 7 years of awesome
author_position: Associate Level I All the Way to Third Manager
pros: Management (and pay) pick the best people to work with.  You'll have a lot of fun.  The pace is busy, your shifts fly by.  You work hard, but as a team.  Its rewarding.  Plus the pay is amazing.  Its easy to get promotions and pay increases, and the raises are huge (.25 - $1 each).
cons: Should be available to work as much as possible.  Your opportunity to related to your availability.  Grooming policy is strict.  Managers can keep you late or send you early on their discretion.  So if you have something to do, you'll be late, if you don't, probably going early--haha.

headline: High Quality Place to Work!
pros:
Super friendly staff
Fun and fast-paced environment
Always busy-time flies!
cons:
Customer complaints
Getting your raise can sometimes feel competitive

headline: Good Place for Students
pros:
Most store managers are willing to be flexible with your hours
There is great starting pay and great benefits.
Great opportunities for advancement.
cons:
The culture of each store is different, it really depends on the store manager
Sometimes, managers can give you a hard time if they don't like you, and HR may take a little while to act on issues.

headline: Level 6
pros: Great work environment, busy so it makes the time go by fast, friendly people, generally friendly customers, they put you on track to advance and do great with training.
cons: On a lot of occasions you're made to stay past your scheduled clock out time, a lot of time with without warning.  Its fast food so the motions are very repetitive and you're required to stand for the whole length of your shift

headline: Hard labor intensive work!
pros:
-Great coworkers
-pay is decent for a first job
-flexible hours
-managers care about advancement
-young employees
-upbeat and fast pace environment
-free food during lunch break
cons:
-very physical demanding work 
-deal with a lot of customers 
-always busy
-only receive a 10 min break EXACTLY for a 6hr. shift.
-you will smell like cheese, onions, and meat mixed with sweat
-you will get dirty 
-lots of cleaning and moving
-night shift includes working till 2:30 AM in the morning.

headline: Overall Goop company has its ups and downs.
pros: Lots of good team building experiences and the company tries really hard to ensure their employees feel like part of a team and enjoy working for them.
cons: Felt like there was a real disconnect between the hourly associates and division management and if an employee wanted to voice an opinion it was difficult to reach anyone other then your store manager.

headline: Perfect job when you need a flexible schedule.
pros:
The benefits are absolutely fantastic. 
Maintaining a flexible schedule is a breeze.
Overall a good work place environment and company culture.
cons: Everyone knows everyone in the company, so there is some corruption and political "red-tape".

headline: Manual Labor, but in the Best Possible Way
pros: Young, youthful staff, great pay, flexibility for students, people are genuinely happy to see you because they love In N Out, the workplace is light and the management is always understanding and helpful.
cons: You do have to do manual labor, but you should know that full well joining the food and service industry.

headline: Great company with great benefits
pros: Good understanding of customer service. Makes you happy to actually work there
cons: None, except that I had to find people to cover my shifts which wasn't too bad

headline: Best fast food place you can work, fast-paced, family-owned, great people. Customers are the worst you can expect.
pros: Fast-paced, lots of room for growth, once you're in, you're pretty much in. Extensive hiring process.. but all that means is they are selective in taking the best.
cons: At the end of the day, you're working in fast food. Always on your feet, complicated customers complaining about tiny details, high level of stress, etc.

headline: Fun first time job for me
pros: Great co workers, fun store parties, friendly people
cons: To become manager you have to work late hours till 2am

headline: I had a fun time working Clean up, but it did not work out because of my school.
pros: Good pay, good upper management
cons: hours did not work with school

headline: Awesome
pros: Worked here for about a year - great atmosphere, coworkers, and best of all...food!
cons: Hours changed frequently - some weeks i had more hours and some I had less.  Management could be a bit nicer, but overall, they're fine.

headline: pretty good
pros: flexible scheduling, free meal, great pay
cons: hours not guaranteed, and perfection is needed.

headline: great stepping stone.
pros: This place starts you off with more than minimum wage hourly. You get 1 free meal per shift. A very steady job too.
cons: They are very strict on your conduct. But its very understandable being they are the only fast food place that pays well.

headline: Good job if you're lucky
pros: free meal every day you work, starting salary is $10 an hour, and work experience.
cons:
getting in trouble for things you cannot control
extremely fast paced
managers play favorites
hard work is sometimes unappreciated
staying later than scheduled without any further notice
rude customers
rude coworkers

headline: Good company overall.
pros: Great compensation for industry. Associate appreciation events are great.
cons: Sometimes training is more quota based for manager's bonuses rather than rewarding hard working associates.

headline: It takes a special person to work here
pros: Good pay, lots of workers at one time, always have something to do. This company has great values and really values the customer.
cons: Too fast paced, have to be totally focused and an extremely fast learner. Can't look like you aren't doing anything. Every employee would tell me something different to do. No matter what, I was doing it wrong.

headline: It is a fast-paced environment that prepares you well for future jobs.
pros: There is great training available to you with a lot of chances to move up in the store.
cons: Managers play favorites and it is sometimes hard to work out a schedule that makes both you and your manager happy.

headline: In N Out is a great company who really cares about its employees. The opportunities to advance are great.
pros: The starting pay is above the minimum wage which is a great for any college student or high school student. They are also very flexible with hours and are very understanding about school:)
cons: You have to work late nights some times and don'y always go home when your shift ends because they need more people to close.

headline: Amazing
pros: Cool place to work for.
cons: Sometimes you have to stay later.

headline: Great Job to help get through college!
pros:
-Pays rather high for Fast Food; Starting Pay is 10.50 in most areas. 
-Fast pace so time seems to go by fast.
cons:
-Repetitive motions, Joints will hurt after a while of working there. 
-Fast pace job, con depending on how you like to work.
 -One free meal per day of work

headline: Great working experience at In-n-Out!
pros: Great Benefits and Salaries.. Love their paid vacations!!
cons: In-n-Out according to me has no flaws!

headline: Good job during high school
pros: High pay for a 16 yr old, free food
cons: Management  needs to remember how the system works. Management generally doesn't know how to do the lower level work because they have been removed from it for so long

headline: Great team building and fast paced customer service.
pros: Love working with a younger crowd and the daily burgers and all you can eat fries! Very good pay for the type of job, and a good leadership program.
cons: There are such a variety of people there from all walks of life that sometimes working with them will   make the shift tense and create a hateful atmosphere. Also, like with most jobs, you will often have a manager that doesn't make good decisions. Also the hours aren't always the best when you are newer.

headline: Fun, fast paced work environment
pros:
-Great starting pay
-Time flies very quickly when you always have something to do
-everybody is a lot of fun to work with and wants you to succeed
-making friends is easy with all the company events
-lots of training
cons:
-Most of the time a customer will call you an idiot and you have to stand there with a smile on your face and agree with them
-very tiring work
-only men can peel potatoes, and being in a store with mostly women, I end up peeling potatoes every day I work

headline: started great but decreasing rapidly.
pros: Takes care of associates, Holiday gift, Great starting pay. Great student job.
cons: Train you to become a robot, All they way is a 'right on' and nothing more. Do EXACTLY what you are told and you will go far. Selective of full time candidates.

headline: Everyone is like a big family (: store #252
pros:
great pay 10$ starting! with frequent raises :) 
in my location all co-workers & managers are nice 
good hours , ive worked about 25 in 5 days (: 
they show you LOTS of videos to show you what they expect 
very understanding of school 
understanding of wanting days off
cons:
really fast paced
they kinda just put me out there , even if it was my first job :P , wish i had for a little more training but they are really just hands on people (:

headline: Loved working for this company
pros:
-great upbeat environment
- pay really well
cons: there was nothing wrong, seriously

headline: Challenging, Family-oriented, Fast-paced
pros: They offer great benefits, good pay and at your own rate.
cons: IT consumed my life at times

headline: Awsome
pros: Great pay, benifiets, and people.
cons: It is fast food lol enough said

headline: Former Associate
pros: Starting pay for a fast food job.  Free food when you work.  Good for people who like a busy atmosphere.
cons: The company really only cares about their bottom line.  I brought up the fact to management that a new associate would do something the wrong way, and they told me that they didn't care--the only reason they were hired was because they were pretty and looked good for customers.

headline: Meh, an ok experience
pros:
Free meal whenever you work
Good wages
Room for growth with the company
Awesome Co Wokers
401k and all that Jazz
cons:
Laborious 
Unfair Management 
No facial Hair
Customer is always right, even when they're not...

headline: I enjoy working with my best friends in a fun and fast pace environment.
pros: Great culture with great people.  Have met some of my best friends working for this company, even met my husband there.  Awesome growth opportunity as they promote from within frequently and sometimes exclusively for some positions.  You are always busy and your days go by fast.  Fun environment.  Can make good money.  Great company history and the leaders are extremely people focused and passionate about the business.
cons: Schedule can be demanding if you go in to management.  May be required to work at different stores that require a long commute.  Stores are very busy so be prepared to work hard and always be one point with customer service.  Leave it all at the door and must have a smile on your face at all times at work.

headline: Nice place to work
pros: Free meal every time you work; friendly management and coworkers; if you work often, more chance for raises
cons: Hectic lunch and dinner hours; if manager is bad, you're going to be stressed and frustrated; if you rarely work, no chance for growth

headline: Great job to get through college.
pros:
Flexible hours, decent pay for a first job. Nice people. So many free burgers!!!

Management has nice bonuses to keep you from leaving.
cons: Be prepared to hustle with a smile.

headline: Stressful and generally not worth it
pros:
- The starting pay at this particular store was $12/hour, which is insanely amazing
- Free burger, fries, and drink every day that you work
cons:
- Favoritism: If you aren't a manager's pet, you'll see yourself get reprimanded for things other people do all the time
- Expected to be nice and peppy to the point of fakeness while managers themselves are rude and not motivating in the least
- Extremely strict dress code, once got in trouble for wearing ankle socks instead of mid calf socks (oh the horror)
- Some days you get off two hours early, the next you're held over your scheduled time by two hours without any notice
- Sometimes you aren't given breaks at all
- You will personally be mocked and made uncomfortable if you work at this particular store
- You will be shown once, very quickly how to perform a task, and then expected to do it yourself, just as quickly, without making a single mistake. To put it simply, the training definitely needs to improve
- A lot of the store's procedures lack efficiency 
- You'll stink of burgers even after a shower
- Managers give you a hard time for things you have no control over
- Employees will actually tell on you for things, and once again, if the manager likes them more than you, you'll get in trouble for it
- Managers behave extremely unprofessionally
- Takes forever to move up
- Every manager acts as though they own the world when they flip burgers for a living

headline: Level 4
pros:
-Free burgers and fries on your lunch break
-Team oriented environment
-Working with other people like me (student)
-No problem getting days off or adding shifts
-Great customers
-If there was something you wanted to be trained on, all you would have to do is ask and someone would train you on that specific task.
cons:
-The culture at times was a bit high school, even though 95% of us were in college.
-Most of the co-workers party together, so if you are not part of that click you sometimes feel left out

headline: awesome place to work, fun  and great enviornment!
pros: the benefits, the way they treat their employees, the work itself is fun, environment is very collaborative and encouraging.
cons: there were no cons really

headline: Fun, Hard Work, Good Job
pros: Free burger per shift, good pay
cons: Low hours, busy days, lots of rude people

headline: Fantastic
pros: good pay , family environment , flexible schedule , room for improvement
cons: none , its a great place to work.

headline: Good place
pros: They treat you like people, and pay well.
cons: Very Very busy all the time.

headline: Great time!
pros: The company really took care of the associates. The best benifits package I have had and fun activities like the "family picnic" are just a few.
cons: Sometimes you don't get along with the managers as they are often young and inexperienced outside of In-N-Out.

headline: INO
pros: Flexible scheduling helps with school
cons: 3 hour shifts make it not even worth going.

headline: Great Culture, Fast Paced Work, Good Hourly Pay
pros: In N Out takes pride in the employees and product. They provide a great first job as well as room for growth. They hold monthly meetings and showcase outstanding employees. We had Christmas parties and small gifts from corporate.
cons: A lot of cleaning. The busy atmosphere is great for some, but may be overwhelming to others.

headline: Bammm.com
pros: Free yummy food! Great managers and employes. Overall A+
cons: No cons I loved working there I wouldn't change a single thing about In-N-Out! 205 is the best!

headline: Good experience, not for everyone.
pros: They work around your school schedule, and are with letting you have some days off.  Starting pay is above average for fast food at $10 an hour.  You get free meals when you work.  Flexible with hours, and you gain customer service experience in a fast paced work environment.
cons: The managers have favorites, and will not discipline them, and move them up faster.  Stressful work environment, you have a manager yelling at you almost everyday, even if you are doing a good job.  Labor intensive work, especially if you are a cook you will be worked very hard.  Lots of drama and politics involved.

headline: Intergrity & Consistency
pros:
Great product
Strong customer based philosophy
Teaches the value of hard work and multi-tasking
Strong mentoring / training 
Flexible scheduling around school demands
cons:
Late nights
You leave smelling like food

headline: cool
pros: cool and better than mickey d's
cons: coolcool and better than mickey d's

headline: Associate
pros:
- Starting salary is $10.
- You get a free burger and fries with whatever you want to drink as long as it's not a shake every time you work.
- Most of the people hired are very frirendly/nice people.
- You learn to work in a fast paced environment.
- Improve a lot on your customer service skills.
cons:
- Customers can get very rude as in any fast food operation.
- There can sometimes be conflicts between associates that effect your job.
- If you cannot handle high stress situations, this is not the right place to work. At all.

headline: It is a fun company to work for
pros: Make new friends, work with fun people, safe environment, lots of bonuses for associates,
cons: Training is a little slow due to few promotion opportunities.

headline: Great high school-kind of job
pros:
Co-workers are down to earth. 
Everyone wants to see you succeed.
Super flexible hours.
Most associates are in early 20's.
Great business model.
cons:
The work is very hard manual labor and is extremely repetitive.
Every day is a chance of some sort of injury.
Everyone wants to take the role of a leader so there is a lot of disagreements and colliding views.
Sometimes you have to work outside using a handheld in the hot sun for 6+hours.

headline: Great company if you get hours.
pros: Alot of free company events. Great team working environment.
cons: I dont get enough hours sometimes.

headline: Awesome food!  Cool uniforms and locations
pros: Tasty food, fresh fries. Great people.
cons: No prestige feeling. Only in California?

headline: Excellent, takes care of its associates well.
pros:
Positive atmosphere, full of team players. Managers are very interested in your development.
Felt good going to work, managers cared.
cons:
Pay is lower in scale at the corporate end, but it is made up for by the environment.
Crowded.

headline: Great company if you know the right people
pros: Flexibility, training, pay, atmosphere, and company culture
cons: A lot of elbow rubbing

headline: It is a high volume quick pace but fun job most days.
pros: Good pay, works by a levle sestem, not how long you have been there but how fast you lern and get raises. good benafits, 401-k, company outings.
cons: Its a highschool mostly work place, so some dramma in locker areas some times. may not always get your hours.

headline: It's like being a part of a family
pros: The people are wonderful. Everyone gets along great and it's always a good time when you're at work. There is never any crazy drama between associates that prevents us from doing our job right.
cons: You work really hard and it's easy to become frustrated or overwhelmed especially with costumers. You are constantly moving or doing something, if you're not, then someone will give you something to do.

headline: Great Experience with memories that will last a life time.
pros: In-N-Out has great pay, full benefits for full timers, Vision/dental for part timers, 401 contribution, company picnics and sports competition.  The work environment is fast-paced and fun if you can make friends with your coworkers.
cons: Irregular schedule, work weekends, nights, and overtime, repetitive motion injury, and you smell like burgers (this could be good or bad).  The environment can be cliquish and it seemed like some managers favor men over women for promotion.

headline: It's an enjoyable fast paced work environment.
pros:
Start at $10.00 per hour  
Flexible work schedules
Taking a vacation is not a problem
Employees are engaging to newcomers
cons: Sometimes managers are not attentive to inventory and a rush comes in and employees must restock kitchen instead of attending to customers.

headline: Great Job for students.  Not for someone looking for a stable job.
pros:
Good Pay.  Starting at 10 an hour with advances at every level.
Lots of responsibility (for a burger joint)
Room to move up.
cons:
No hours.   This is actually why I had to leave.  I had 6 hours a week by the end of my employment, and I was a good employee; getting 4 raises in 3 months.
If you are a student its great but if you need to pay rent and bills you won't be able to afford to stay with them

headline: level 1 associate
pros: great company to work for
cons: hard work and very tiring but rewarding

headline: It used to be a good company to work for
pros: A steady paycheck and various locations.
cons: Founders are no longer alive, new leadership is out of touch with reality. They do not take care of people who get hurt on the job. Divisional managers in central California tend to sweep problems under the rug. Upper management tends to be very arrogant and have unrealistic expectations of the people below them. Lots of politics. Claim to be a christian company (look under the cups) but nothing could be further from the truth. H.R. tends to sweep issues under the rug as well. Not much diversity ( very few black people get hired). The rest of the list is too long to mention.

headline: Like a Well Oiled Machine!
pros: family company, christmas presents for every employee every year, bonuses for employees for reaching sales goals, high energy atmosphere, very detailed training sets one up for success, work with school/second job schedules
cons: only burgers, fries, and shakes..... I went to culinary school while working there, so it wasnt enough for me once I graduated. Also, if an employee wants to move up the corporate ladder, there is ALOT of competition

headline: It has been amazing working for a company that doesn't take its employees or customers for granted.
pros: Great attitudes of all associates. Managers are just as hard working as employees. Great base pay for employees. Chance to move up in company.  All around very clean place.
cons: Honestly I can't think of any cons. It has been my best work experience yet. Awesome job to have.

headline: Amazing company!!!
pros: Great atmosphere, great co-workers, great management, company picnics, great customers, industry leading compensation
cons: I didn't see any cons in the company

headline: Fun but extreme hard work and perfection
pros: The pay at Innout is good for a fast food restaurant. Most of the managers are laid back and cool. They always use positive phrases. They always says their pleases and thank yous. Coworkers will tell you good job all the time.
cons: The main priority is to keep the customer happy, no matter what. It is a bit stressful, because Innout gets so busy. Its a lot of hard work to do. No matter what position you are in, it gets stressful.

headline: Fun working with friends. If you're just wanting a part-time job, it's great! HoweverI would not recommend a career here
pros:
Decent starting pay
Flexible schedule 
Paid holidays (Easter, Thanksgiving, Christmas)
Really good benefits for full-timers, for part-time they offer good vision, and dental insurance.
cons:
It sucks working late night shifts all the time. 
Open until 1am on weekdays and 130am on weekends, so if you close be prepared to become an insomniac.
Managers often make false promises.
Very political
A lot of gossip in the company

headline: Intern
pros: Fun environment.  Good place to work.
cons: Political.  You have to know people to move up.

headline: Hard Work but Good Pay and benefits
pros:
Good Pay
Friendships
Family Oriented 
Many Benefits
cons:
Hard work
Fast food
Sweat
Cut labor hours
After work smell

headline: Fast pace and fun environment
pros: They wil quickly advance you if you are willing and wanting to work harder. Fast pace fun environment time flies by.
cons: If it isn't busy time goes by slow and they send you home. If you aren't ready for a fast pace work environment then this is not the job for you.

headline: Awesome first job
pros:
Free burger and fries every day you work
New friends
Awesome managers
Great experience
Looks great on resume
cons: You will get really fat

headline: fun
pros: fast paced. good money. fun.
cons: hard work. smelly. have to work all holidays.

headline: Good management, Great Co-Workers, Overall an awesome place to work!
pros:
Working at In N Out Burger, provided flexible work scheduling when you needed. Ex School

Management here was awesome and treated me with respect and we're just great people to work with.

My Co-Workers I met are easy to get along with, and have become some of my close friends.
cons: This is a very fast paced environment so if you can't handle being on you're feet all day without a lot of breaks than this might not be for you.

headline: Good
pros: Fun environment to work in.
cons: Wish they paid more for associates.

headline: Great company.
pros: In N Out provides a very upbeat and positive work environment. They motivate progress and promotions. Very well structured and professional.
cons: The fast paced work environment can be a little stressful at times. The occasional oil burn  can be a little of annoying.

headline: Great place for students to work.  If you are a high school/college student this is a great job to get you by.
pros: The people that work there are typically students with similar personality.  Everyone on the team is very friendly.  Another added perk is the fact you get free food when you work, but that is assumed that every restuarant chain would provide that benefit
cons: The work.  It is very labor intensive but the work environment is enjoyable because of the staff.  In-N-Out is becoming too strict and coming down hard on policies.  I had some of my best times working at In-n-Out when I was first hired.  I was an employee for 5+ years and have seen alot of change recently.

headline: Fast pace, team oriented atmosphere.
pros: The company appreciates their associates and compensates by providing great pay and benefits.  There is great opportunity for growth within the company.
cons: None I can think of.

headline: still getting interviewed
pros: the pay is pretty good
cons: mean people may ruin a good experience

headline: Started inspiring, but turned into a dead end.
pros: In-N-Out is a great place to work if you're in high school or in college. The starting pay is very high with respect to its competitors. Associates get free meals, paid vacations, great benefits, great 401k profit sharing, and great flexibility in regards to work hours.
cons: In-N-Out is expanding very rapidly. With increased expansion, the company is losing sight of what their core values are. Friendliness, cleanliness, and freshness. Managers are getting promoted to fast, and with this comes new found abuse of power. Associates work extremely hard so that managers can get their "numbers". Managers have lost sight of morality and ethics. The workplace is very fast paced and with this comes competition to move up in the ranks. We are all human beings. As humans, we favor other people that would benefit us. Favoritism is an ugly form to get raises.

headline: Not what a employee promotion is allllll about....
pros: Flexibility with school schedule, friendly overall environment.
cons: Coming home smelling like french fries and grease.  Favoritism among certain managers and associates, leading to petty disputes and conflict.

headline: Strict, but pays the bills, nice to work in a team that is all the same age
pros: Its nice working with a group of people your age. management is a little strict and if you don't want to exceed everyone's expectations there is a good chance you can become an outcast.
cons: They play favorites, sometimes you can get in trouble for nothing, just make sure you have a good perception and relationship with management. Learn to ask questions about their life.

headline: good first job when you are still going to school
pros: you can have flexible hours
cons: no health benefit if not full-time.

headline: it has been my foundation to future opportunities
pros: if you start while your in high school the pay is great compared to any other at that young age. Most of the other associates are also the same age lots of fun
cons: out with the old in with the new. The younger one don't know any better all they see is the $$$$$ they will do what ever you ask of them once that money horse is done move them along.NEXT

headline: Excellent, Great opportunities for growth
pros: Great salaries, Is a type of job that can help you accomplish the american dream. The opportunities of growth are endless. If  you have what it takes this is the job for you
cons: Lots of pressure, work long hours. The higher you move up the more they own you. Extremely stressful for small situations. Dealing with lots of teenage kids.

headline: horrible
pros: good pay and opportunities to move up within the company. where good when it came to customer service and cleanliness.
cons: Sends employees home after working a hour, Didn't train just threw me out there to figure things out on my own, and wouldnt work around school schedules.
